Mick Chillage.title: A Distant Reflection
Mick Chillage.about:
"A Distant Reflection" is the 10th in my series of long form Ambient/Experimental works which started in the beginning of 2020.
This track started out with just the sound of two drinking glasses being tapped together in various ways recorded with my Zoom portable recorder about two weeks ago.
This week I imported the recordings into Ableton and with some editing made some rhythmical elements from the sounds, further manipulations of the sound resulted in some inspirations with my prophet Rev2, creating some atmospheric pads/drones that shift in key forming a foundation for some improvised synth work using my Supernova II, The Korg MS20 Mini, The Moog Grandmother. Multi-tracking these synths a couple of times to build up a rich sonic canvas. One other sound recording from my zoom was also added, a rather mundane domestic chore that was manipulated a little to hide the source but to add some mystery..
The basis of the track was composed in one evening.
The following night I retuned and added some subtle yet improvised piano keys courtesy of the Native Instruments Maverick Grand Piano instrument.
The final challenge was to make this work as a long form piece.
I arranged and mixed and mastered it the following day.
I hope this latest composition gives you as much joy and calm to
listen to it as it did for me while working on it.
Mick Chillage July 2020
Mick Chillage.credits:
released July 30, 2020
Composed, recorded, arranged and mastered by Michael Gainford
at The Igloo Dublin July 2020.
Photo: Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: A Distant Reflection
Mick Chillage.about:
A Distant Reflection was originally written and recorded in 2020 and was originally released as a long form digital release only. Clocking in at almost 60 minutes long "A Distant Reflection" explores the relationship between deep shifting atmospheric synth drones, unusual found sounds/field recordings and emotive improvised key sections that bring a sense of stillness and subtle emotional impact.
Upon its original release the feedback from various supporters was very strong and it has been one of those digital pieces that some have requested a physical CD release on a few occasions and as a personal favourite I felt it was time to release it on CD.
Some of the supporters feedback on the original release.
mickchillage.bandcamp.com/album/a-distant-reflection
b_d:
I slept so well! really chilled and wonderful :-)
Ambientcosmos:
Beautiful, drifting, immersive soundscape.
Dimitar_Dodovski:
Soothing, pastel cloud of ambient tones reminiscent of Eno's Apollo. Its floating and cycling quality makes it suitable for thinking, relaxation or art installation!
David Prescott:
An absolutely favorite from one of my absolute favorites. An excellent long-form ambient track from a master of the genre.
For this 2023 CD release I decided to return to the track and I have made some subtle changes to the mix and arrangement. the addition of further stereo enhancement, additional FX sweeps giving it a more dream like essence in certain moments and changing the end with the reappearance of the improvised piano as the track fades away.
To fill the CD I've also included to brand new compositions which I feel compliment the title track but also stand on their own as shorter pieces.
The album "A Distant Reflection" clocks in at almost 8o minutes of somewhat personal thought provoking reflective ambience to immerse yourself in.
I hope you enjoy this new version and its accompanying pieces.
Mick Chillage
May 2023

Mick Chillage.title: A Moog & A Kalimba
Mick Chillage.about:
In early August 2020 I was tinkering with my rather basic 5 note Kalimba, I liked the harmonic tones I was getting from it by strumming it and letting my fingernails drag over its keys or lamellas as they are known as, playing randomly and rhythmically.
I decided to record an improvised session using my Zoom H1 recorder.
I imported the recordings into Ableton live and started to manipulate the recordings in various ways, which created an eerie/alien like metallic sound which became the foundation of the track.
I then turned to the Moog Grandmother and tuned it to the manipulated Kalimba and began creating various patches, improvising and recording and multi tracking until I had a structure that began to work for me.
For additional depth, I turned to the Prophet Rev2 and I created some polyphonic atmospheres/drones that shift and became the second foundation.
Once I had enough elements to play around with I began to arrange the individual performances/recordings with the hope that the elements would work as a long form piece.
During this time, the track seemed to take on a life of its own, the mixing and arranging seemed almost effortless a synergy of acoustic, analogue & digital technology resulting in an alien yet haunting feel but with a sense of hope and optimism.
Well that's how it speaks to me.
Mick Chillage Sept 2020.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released September 3, 2020
written, arranged, mixed, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin August 2020.
Photo: Michael Gainford
A new mix & 24Bit Remaster was created in January 2025

Mick Chillage.title: A Soul Like Winter
Mick Chillage.about:
"A Soul Like Winter" was created in the first week of January 2023.
After a period of no music production thanks to Covid and its residual effects I had not worked on any music in almost one month, so I was delighted to start working again with a fresh perspective & enthusiasm.
The main track was inspired initially by a patch I had created sometime back on my trusty Prophet Rev2, a little bit of further editing lead me to some deep drone like chords and some long takes with many different parameters being tweaked to create a dark shifting atmospheric undertone.
Next was some subtle yet emotive improvised piano keys, and a little bit of searching through my archive of found sounds/field recordings led me to some elements that complimented the sonic foundations.
Within these sounds I began to imagine a sort of icy industrial environment and could envision a frozen landscape with distant machines clonking away, this inspired me further and managed to focus on a theme of a soulless industrial structure working away on its own without the aid of humanity.

Mick Chillage.title: Abandoned Memories
Mick Chillage.about:
"Abandoned Memories" was written and recorded in late summer/early autumn of 2023 and sees myself returning to my more introspective reflective improvised style of ambient music with perhaps a hint of Neo classical?
The first piece written was "Remember to Forget" and In recent years I seem to have developed an interest/fascination in music composed around a foundation of sustained drones. Although "Remember to Forget" opens with a simple atmospheric chord progression it was the pulsing/bouncing like synth that was essentially the starting point of the track. The piano part was composed over these two elements along with the haunting breathing like voice synth.
The title track was born from a sustained drone that has some shifts in amplitude & frequency, I sat and improvised some keys for a while with a couple of different passes, one in particular resonated with me and I then made some edits to it fixing where I was either a little too hard on key velocity or too low and also fixing any notes that felt a little out of time in some places, some passes have slightly different nuances in notes and FX etc to keep a natural feel.
The addition of some recent field recordings and additional subtle synth accompaniment assisted the lengthy improvised passages and aided the long form arrangement of this piece which I hope works as an emotive yet comforting place to immerse yourself in.
The middle piece "Reconcile" is the shorter of the two but applies a slightly different approach, an initial improvised synth pad acts as the main foundation with some simple but emotive high key counterpoints, a subtle minimalist ambient piece that creates a different yet coherent mood.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released November 23, 2023
Written, produced and mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin 2023
Art and layout Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Acceptance (Extended Mix)
Mick Chillage.about:
A shorter version of "Acceptance" was originally released on one of the popular Neo Tantra digital compilations series in of Spring of 2020.
Written during the first part of the pandemic I always felt that the track could have been longer, so about one month back I retuned to it. The Covid 19 virus certainly marked a time for us all where we had to make some very serious changes in our lives and adapt which caused a sense of uncertainty and fear in most of us.
In all our personal lives we sometimes are forced to make changes at times, this can be very painful or frightening but during this process we can become better versions of ourselves or it can be an awakening to gifts or qualities we were not aware of.
My intention with the extended version was to subtly add new musical pieces or atmospheres that reflected the changing/challenging times we live in with perhaps haunting or uncertain tones yet also moments that suggest we are about to go through a collective metamorphosis which may bring a better world in the future.
Mick Chiilage August 2020
Mick Chillage.credits:
released August 13, 2020
Written, arranged, mixed and mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin Spring/Sumner 2020.
January 2025 "Acceptance" got a new mix & 24Bit master
Photo & layout Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Acid Forms Volume One
Mick Chillage.about:
I guess it was the arrival of Acid house/Techno in the late eighties that began my true journey deep into electronic music, sure before this movement happened electronic music was already on my radar from the wonderful soundtracks of John Carpenter, Vangelis & Tangerine Dream etc to UK acts such as Art of Noise, Depeche Mode & Cabaret Voltaire & of course the perfect synth pop of Kraftwerk had already left a huge influence on me.
But there was something about these alien sounding dance tracks that captured my attention & got me hooked. The acts behind these works were mysterious and in many cases you could tell these tracks were made with very little equipment and often not a great musical ability but with a lot of imagination & passion, this was kinda like a new movement of electronic punk.
Over the years the sound merged and mutated, some stayed firmly underground and others more mainstream, many times it became predictable and overused and I got bored with the sound on some levels.
Over the years I myself have incorporated the acid sound in some of my Ambient, electro, techno tracks etc but in late 2023 I began to think the Acid sound had maybe run its ground but there was some unfinished business with the relationship I have with this sonic culture.
I asked myself "Why not go back and create a body of work that tries to respect the original sound yet delivers something new that feels like hearing it all again for the first time, a challenge indeed and only you the listener can decide if I have come close.
Jan 2024 I began to work on material utilising some limited analogue equipment to begin with, just to keep it in the spirit of many of the early tracks, quickly ideas began to form and develop. I was mindful that these tracks would need some variation in style and BPMS so 909s 808s and other drum sounds were incorporated.
By mid Spring of 2024 I had about eleven pieces that I was very happy with. Some are pure acid Techno/House jams with a dark underground edge, others are more playful in moments & some are home listening atmospheric acid works that draw later influences that utilised the acid sound.
I hope you enjoy this first volume of Acid Forms and I hope to complete Volume 2 before the end of 2024.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released August 22, 2024
All tracks written, programmed, mixed & mastered by
Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin through 2024.
Art & layout by Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Alba Patera
Mick Chillage.about:
"Alba Paltera" was written and recoded in April of 2023.
The two main sound sources are analogue synths;
The Moog Grandmother, where some long shifting evolving modulated drone patches where recorded at various pitches and then layered. The Prophet Rev2 provided the more subtle poly ambient textures which give the track that break from the ominous dark and heavy alien tones which are the foundation of the track.
The Moog is also used for a sequence section that shifts in and out that suggests a sense of discovery or a deeper sense of mystery.
While working on the arrangement, the music began to conjure otherworldly visions of an alien landscape being explored or monitored from a safe distance as hi tech devices send back various data on this new and fascinating planet, a cliche maybe but one that fits the soundscapes that emerged from my mind to my synths.
Equipment used:
Moog Grandmother
Prophet Rev2
Korg SQ1 seqeuncer.
Ableton Live 10 for audio arranging and digital manipulation of some sound sources and FX.
Hope you enjoy!
Mick Chillage April 2023.

Mick Chillage.title: Alter Of Illusions
Mick Chillage.about:
Initial Programs is my alter ego which was born in 2016 from the idea of starting from scratch on a synth that its program parameters have been initialised to zero & building sounds from there with a canvas that is open to myriad of influences within electronic music.
The first release "What Tomorrow Brings" in 2017 was a three track EP on 12" vinyl that blurred the lines between Techno, Electro, IDM etc.
Then in 2023 the album "Are We Programmed"  mickchillage.bandcamp.com/album/are-we-programmed
took these concepts further and incorporated Ambient, touches of Jazz, experimental electronics, soundtrack influences that merged with many contemporary groove based electronica genres the album also featured the tracks from "What Tomorrow Brings"
The third Initial Programs release "Alter Of Illusions" started in 2024 which takes a tougher and more brutal edge at times, mutating the 80s and 90s blueprint of Techno & Electro with raw analogue aesthetics sitting with some widescreen ambient atmospheres & 21st century digital manipulations/production techniques creating a world where each piece has a sense of shifting sonic architecture both familiar and alien in equal measure.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released September 4, 2025
Written, produced and mastered by Michael Gainford at the
Igloo Dublin 2025.
Art & Design and original photograph by Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Altostratus
Mick Chillage.about:
"Altostratus" was written in spring of 2023.
The initial idea came about when I was experimenting with the FM synthesis capabilities of my Novation Supernova II, although its one of the oldest synths in my arsenal, this is an area of the synth which I haven't explored all that much.
I ended up with a pretty basic yet classic sounding FM bass and played a longish improvised/shifting bass-line that kind of carries the track along throughout its duration.
The other elements came together quickly with some sounds edited and played from my Prophet Rev 2.
This day in particular was a pleasant spring day and as the clouds rolled by my roof-light window I decided to record the sounds that were present outside and recorded a couple of passes of distant traffic and a jet plane overhead.
I tried to capture an accompanying soundtrack to those moments where I would often lie down and watch the clouds pass by on those warm summer days on the bank of my local river, I returned to my archive of field recordings of this area and included another recording which captured some environmental/naturalistic aesthetics.
I was very pleased how this track came about in a short period with the addition of some subtle improvised keys it added further emotional sentiments.
I hope that this thirty minutes of Ambient music can add a sense of calm and peaceful/comforting familiarity to your day.
"Autumn Falls" was also written in the spring of 2023 but its inputus goes back to November of 2022 where I had captured the roar of my local waterfall after a heavy few days of rain. In spring I recently acquired an acoustic guitar and purchased a new microphone, my intention was to simply capture some guitar textures and maybe play some basic chords or plucked elements.
I had said to myself "as an experiment, no mater how simple the first part I play and record is, I will try to create a piece of music from it" So, the basic picked guitar phrase was used as the foundation to "Autumn Falls" the recording of the water fall was added along with all the various synth parts and FX that completed the track and feels like the perfect companion to "Altostratus"
I hope you enjoy!
Mick Chillage March 2023
Mick Chillage.credits:
released March 30, 2023
Written, produced & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin 2023.
Photo and layout by Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Amen Forms
Mick Chillage.about:
The concept for "Amen Forms" came about while I was compiling tracks for another possible "Orphaned Tracks" volume. I came across a piece I had been working on way back in 2017 "The Forgotten Trail" The track already had a sort of breakbeat feel with some programmed drums but I felt an additional break beat mashed up would bring additional dynamics, I added the classic Amen break sample and played around with the track some more, I was kind of inspired and began to think of how versatile and how many styles this hugely influential drum loop had adapted to so well over the many decades of electronic music.
Over the next couple of months I had the concept in my head and as various tracks came together some new and some unfinished ideas I would add various permutations of the loop, spliced and digitally manipulated in as many forms as I could within different genres.
The end result is seven tracks all with quite distinct themes/aesthetics spanning different genres & BPMs; From very serious emotional & atmospheric pieces to more playful pieces.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released July 20, 2023
Written and produced by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin
Ireland between 2017 to 2023.
Original Photo: Cory Mills
Art & Layout Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Anemoi
Mick Chillage.about:
I've always had something of a phobia with the wind, particularly when winds reach storm force and you can hear and feel things shifting by its power, yet of course a light breeze on a warm day is welcome and pleasant.
Living in Ireland we regularly have Atlantic storms that cover Ireland particularly through the autumn months & during these I find it hard to relax and sleep at night as my sensory sensitivity anxiety begins to to take hold.
So, the inspiration for this album came about sort of unexpectedly with the opening track "Boreas" and its wind like sweeping tones & somewhat dark & foreboding aesthetic. Initially I thought maybe I'd call this track "Ancraophobia" the technical term for fear of the wind.
After some googling I was led to the greek mythical god Boreas and this seemed to fit better.
I found it fascinating that there was individual gods for each wind known as the"Anemoi" [Gods of the four winds] and kept this in mind as I worked on more tracks over a pretty short period of time with each track trying to reflect the character of each wind god.
From a production aesthetic I wanted to create the soundscapes purely synth based and avoid adding any natural sounds of wind being used and instead went for white noise and resonant sweeps and deep bass amongst other techniques.
I hope you enjoy my latest work that explores one of natures forces that can be both pleasing & destructive.
Mick Chillage January 2026.

Mick Chillage.title: Anisotropic Synchrony
Mick Chillage.about:
I wasn't planning to release any new music until end of June with my next CD album "Brain Oscillations"
Late spring/early summer 2022 has seen the sad passing of four deeply influential figures within electronic music.
Firstly the passing of Klaus Schulze a hugely influential figure often coined the Godfather of Techno which my forthcoming "Brain Oscillations CD is influenced by and dedicated to.
Next we had the passing of Vangelis a household name in electronic music due to his wonderful soundtrack work and a career that spanned six decades with a myriad of musical styles that always had a sense of majestic melody and timeless beauty.
In the last week Andy Fletcher of Depeche Mode sadly left us at only sixty years of age. Many of us grew up with Andy as we watched DM mutate from their early synth pop to a deeply influential electronic music group that matured and have written and produced so many timeless albums that often defy genre.
And lastly we lost Dave Smith the incredible talent behind the Sequential synth brand and many iconic instruments like the Prophet series and also developed the MIDI system which redefined the electronic music creation process in the late 80's.
Track one "Anisotropic Synchrony" was created with only Prophet sounds but with some additional digital manipulation on some source material.
Track Two "Astronauts Eye" is more experimental Ambient and continues with the theme of Light and the phenomena that astronauts often experience is space with light. This track was written only two days ago.
Track three "Extinguished Light" was composed shortly after the passing of Vangelis and is of a somewhat sombre yet otherworldly tone.
Mick Chillage.credits:

Mick Chillage.title: Architects Of Existence
Mick Chillage.about:
Mick Chillage, the hardest working man in (ambient) show business, has joined forces with Eric the Taylor to make our daily lives go down just a bit sweeter. Theyve coined themselves the Architects of Existence, and, yes, its a weighty moniker, but listening to these four epic-lengths pieces of broadband drift youre happy that the dynamic duos at least got lofty ambitions. Its pleasing to know that between them theyve cooked up one helluva work of sonic fiction here. Grandiose, epoch-spanning, this is the stuff that dreams are made of. Chillage and Taylor are two of electronicas Nobel laureates so that even the luxurious gyrating buzz of their metallic sequencers make nice on the inner ear while their synths gently weep. And hats off to the artists for wearing their analog hearts on their sleevesthe second movements slow-twist discourse is equal parts Steve Roach and mentor Namlook, along with a hint of Mark Ishams score from The Hitcheremotional environmental music of pearlescent luster and quiet reckoning, drawn with careful poise and an Architects touch.
Purchase CD's or downloads from:
architectsofexistence.bandcamp.com/album/architects-of-existence

Mick Chillage.title: Are We Programmed?
Mick Chillage.about:
The alias "Initial Programs" is a Mick Chillage project and was born in late 2016 after creating a track where all the sounds were created from scratch, basically from the default Initialised program setting of my Mopho X4 synth along with my MS20 mini etc.
The track I created appeared to have a lot of my electronic music genre influences, Techno, Electro, touches of the IDM movement, Ambient, Acid, so I thought to myself, wouldn't it be an interesting project to create a release that brings together as many of my influences as possible by merging them into each track.
In 2017 I had finished the first EP and this was released through First Cut on 12" vinyl in early 2018 and was very well received from many well known Techno & Electro DJ's and producers. This kept the momentum going to hopefully create an albums worth of material.
So over the last few years I continued randomly producing works with this alias in mind with the hope of producing a full length album and by early 2022 I began selecting tracks to make a coherent album.
August 2023 finally sees the release "Are We Programmed" a twelve track album that features the three tracks from the EP for First time on CD and nine new previously unreleased works.
credits

Mick Chillage.title: Between Moments
Mick Chillage.about:
Originally released on CD at Before & After Silence Recordings Bandcamp
In 2018 I released "Between The Endless Silence" on Carpe Sonum Novum. This album was a collection of Improvised Piano based ambient works that I had created between 2015 to 2016.
Shortly after these works were completed and selected for the album I continued to work with this momentum of piano based improvisation pieces into 2017 where the body of what is now on "Between Moments" was pretty much completed.
The original five pieces clocked in closer to one hundred minutes of music which was way too long for a single CD release and I was very happy with how these pieces had turned out I waited until the right time came along to release on CD.
I put this project away [on hold] for some time but it was never forgotten and it would regularly pop back into my mind that I would need to complete it and arrange it for a CD release.
In 2022 I returned to it over a period of time and re-arranged some tracks to get it just under 80 mins, luckily no musical elements were lost and I was very careful not to loose any of the tracks emotional. atmospheric impact during the edits.
2024 I return to it again with fresh ears and fix some mixing details and issues. By early spring I'm very happy with the new arrangements, mix etc and decide this will be the 2nd release of 2024 on Before & After Silence Recordings.
credits

Mick Chillage.title: Between the Endless Silence
Mick Chillage.label: Carpe Sonum Records
Mick Chillage.about: The inimitable Mr. Chillage seems to go from strength-to-strength with each and every new release, armed with a diligent, focused work ethic and a surfeit of imagination, which makes his latest Carpe Sonum Novum missive a pleasant, diverse surprise. Perhaps hes immersed himself in Harold Budd and Tim Story records, as hes chosen for this release to center his already gorgeously pealing whorls of ambient discourse around the keystrokes of the piano. But wait: lest you roll your eyes and bemoan the entry of yet another electronic musician who fancies himself a classical composer, Micks tickling of the ivories isnt mere folly or a gestural jape. Instead, the artist has, intentionally or inadvertently, created a paean to the elegaic minimalistic sides forged by Mssrs. Budd & Eno, couched in the softly irising synthetic thermals hes arranged over countless works in his formidable catalog. Between the Endless Silence isnt therefore your typical piano-centered blandishment, nor a stuffy bit of experimentation, or even its creators desire to abandon his chosen field. Instead, Chillage has done the next to impossible, recontextualizing the delicate filigree of the acoustic grand throughout a wonderfully luxurious fabric of electronica, refracting a veritable font of melodies that linger in the head long after the disc concludes. Had this been issued in the early 80s, it would be considered a well-established classic; well just assume that right now, and brandish it accordingly. Play it late at night or early in the morning; either way, its more brilliant than the sun.

Mick Chillage.title: Between The Endless Silence

"Between The Endless Silence" is possibly my most personal record to date. Encompassing the sound of improvised key performances, field recordings & subtle synth Ambience's it reflects the physical world around us with its beauty & decay and perhaps triggers memories and emotions from the regretful to the hopeful, like a sonic capture of a thoughtful reflective pause.

Mick Chillage.title: Beyond The Endless Silence
Mick Chillage.about:
In 2018 I released my "Between The Endless Silence" CD album on
Carpe Sonum Novum, the album was quite a bit of a departure from my usual Ambient recordings, although on some previous works I had showcased some moments of improvised or composed piano works.
"Between The Endless Silence" was a very personal body of work that was based around the piano and focused more on thoughtful and sentimental compositions, subtle ambient undertones and field recordings.
Sitting somewhere between Modern Classical/minimalism.
The Title track "Between The Endless Silence" which finished the album" is a 20 minute piece of gentle looping piano phrases, field recordings and haunting soundscapes. Over the years, I've had several requests for a longer version, as some people have said it worked very well for meditative purposes and has helped them with anxiety etc..
So I decided to return to the piece to see if I could extend it and mix it with some new subtle musical parts that change the mood a little, perhaps a little darker but to return you to the serenity of the original. I'm quite pleased with this extended version and it sits well with the three other new/previously unreleased tracks which were recorded in 2017, 2018, and "A Chair And A Window" which was most recently written and recorded in May 2020.
I Decided this new version shall be titled "Beyond The Endless Silence" and Ideally played at the end of this album, due to its duration and subtle nature you may drift in and out of sleep but certain themes will fade and return so hopefully you won't miss all the elements.
I really feel the album should be played at low to medium volume and with minimal distractions.
Dedicated to the memories of Natalie & Ziv who sadly left us on May 14th 2020.
Album was given a 24Bit Remaster in Jan 2025

Mick Chillage.title: Brain Oscillations
Mick Chillage.about:
Brain Oscillations is a return perhaps to a more Ambient Space Music aesthetic after the rather organic and poignant piano based "Urban Nature" although I would consider this more like head space music.
The initial impetus of this release was born from the sad passing of Klaus Schulze an artist that was synonymous with the "Kosmische Musik" of the early 70's and someone who was very much regarded as one of the true pioneers of this music which spawned from the early experimental kraut rock movement in Germany.
The passing of Klaus had shocked and moved the electronic music scene across the board, his trademark hypnotic sequences had left a huge influence on the dance music scene that emerged in the 80's and continues today which is why he was given the hefty title of "The Godfather Of Techno" but there was so much more to his music than this.
So, upon his passing I found myself revisiting some of his works and reading the liner notes of a particular album Klaus had described his style of music creation as "Brain Oscillations" this very distinct & descriptive term got me thinking about possible music that may inspire me and perhaps be my own homage to his influence.
At first I thought it would probably be just one piece of music if I was lucky enough to get inspired. The first track I created which is the opening piece was born from the deep ascending shifting poly synth sound I had created from on my Prophet Rev2 that appears at the twelve minute mark. I turned to my trusty Moog Grandmother and built up a selection of various modulated frequencies, these formed the slowly developing intro of the track as more sustained poly drones & classic sounding synth parts etc were added. The bones of track one was developed in one evening.
I also made a conscious decision not to use any sequenced synth parts as I felt this would have been the most obvious element to emulate but instead to use lengthy poly synth chords, drones, keys, leads and wild synth modulations that suggest a burst of neuron activity or that may stimulate the mind on a sensory & emotional level.
Luckily this mindset of creative thinking led me to completing two other tracks within a short time frame which I felt had a strong continuous theme.
For KS.
Equipment used on this album.
Dave Smith Prophet Rev2
Moog Grandmother
Korg MS20 Mini
Emu ESI 4000 sampler
Electro Magnetic contact Mic
Acoustic Guitar
Ableton Live 10 for audio sequences mix and digital FX & treatments.

Mick Chillage.title: Celestial Observations
Mick Chillage.about:
Celestial Observations was created in Autumn 2020, the album only utilises sounds that came from my various synthesizers.
What started out as experiment with layering monophonic drones, created mainly on the Moog grandmother at first it developed by various modulation patching of each part the sound would morph and change over time.
I recorded these long droning/morphing passages and eventually built on top of these foundations with some polyphonic patches I created on the Prophet Rev2 & Novation Supernova.
In some pieces however they only consist of monophonic sounds, on tracks one & four.
Within a few weeks I had the bones of an album, six tracks in all but I narrowed it down to five pieces, the omitted piece will be used elsewhere in the future. I felt these works definitely had an other worldly expanse to them and had a sense of dark & light and gave me a feeling of exploring the vastness of universe & beyond.
The title "Celestial Observations" seemed apt
I hope you enjoy my return to the more "Space Ambient" spectrum on this album
Mick Chillage
Feb 2021.
credits
released February 15, 2020
Written, mixed, recorded at the Igloo Dublin 2020 & 2021
Artwork Tony Obr

Mick Chillage.title: Celestial Observations 2
Mick Chillage.about:
The first "Celestial Observations" album was the second release on Before & After Silence recordings & one of the best sellers on the label so far, its mix of spatial drones, improvised synths, experimentalism & atmospheric aesthetic appeared to appeal to the Berlin School/Space music fans as much as the Ambient minimalist drone appreciators as I feel it fell in between these two spheres.
"Celestial Observations 2" continues with these themes but this time I created the album with the intension of it being something listened to in one sitting.
Ten tracks shift and morph through dark & light passages of varying duration that pays homage and respect to the amazing minds that invented the various telescopes that enable us to view the cosmos and gather more insight to many theories & mysteries that have fascinated star gazers since the dawning of man.

Mick Chillage.title: Circadian Rhythm
Mick Chillage.about:
In early May of 2023 I had an accident on my BMX bike and suffered a fracture to my skull just above my eyebrow and also a concussion as a result.
Just before this accident I had created a new patch on My prophet Rev2 which kind of reminded me of those eerie bell like tones sometimes heard on Aphex Twin/Locust records. During my concussion I found it very difficult to focus on anything and creating music was difficult, but three weeks later I went back to the patch and built up a track mainly utilising this sound in various ways.
Although not fully recovered and working in short time spans of maybe 20/30 minutes per night a piece began to emerge and within a few days I knew I had the bones of something worthwhile. As my condition improved I finally arranged and mixed the track which became "Supraorbital" [Thanks to Dave @ Carpe Sonum for the title] a twenty five minute piece which has two distinct movements.
The other two tracks "Circadian Rhythm" and "Zeitgeber" were pieces which I had been working on prior to my accident and with a bit of additional work they seemed to fit the theme that had developed.
The title track "Circadian Rhythm" & "Zeitgeber" relates to the cycle of our sleep pattern which now had become somewhat disturbed for me as I slept much of the day and now had trouble sleeping at night, thankfully this has pretty much resolved.
A "zeitgeber" is any external or environmental cue that entrains or synchronizes an organism's biological rhythms, usually naturally occurring and serving to entrain to the Earth's 24-hour light/dark and 12-month cycles.

Mick Chillage.about:
Over the years a lot of my music has appeared on various compilations from digital to CD & vinyl.
The tracks featured on Compiled Vol: 1 have not featured anywhere
else before & were exclusive to the compilations they appeared on.
I decided to compile these very varied works and make them available in one collection.
The tracks pretty much follow in sequence as they where released so the first track "Check This Out" is a very early electro track from about 2000 and featured on a rather limited CDr which was used to promote an Electro club night in Dublin called Neuromantek where I had been a guest DJ, so a little bit of early history there.
As the years went by I featured tracks on some bigger labels & along side some of my influential artists. below is the track list & the compilations they appeared on.

Mick Chillage.title: Departure [First Class Edition]
Mick Chillage.about:
In 2009 I released my second EP "Departure" for Irish based Techno label Nice and Nasty now in their 20th year.Nice and Nasty are better known for their more dancefloor friendly cuts so the title "Departure"seemed more than fitting for the release that consisted of four "Chill Out" or "Downtempo" electronic music that ranged from elements of Jazz to soundtrack inspired ambience to bleepy and bass driven frequencies.
Shortly after the release of the original EP a collection of remixes followed, a remix EP of each track every three months which saw the likes of Finlands IDM master Lackluster turning out a couple of rather stunning glitchy yet emotive remixes.
Dave Anderson [Ferox] Showing of his distinct freestyle keyboard playing style amongst some funky yet minimal grooves.Tomas Jirku's remix went off on a really deep musical and majestic vibe.
Ireland's new techno shinning light The Parellel turned out a solid chunk of abstract electro which got some airplay on Dave Clarke's White Noise radio show and UK based IDM/Classical
veteran Pentatonik delivered an epic cinematic remix of The Final Storm.

Mick Chillage.title: Deviazoni Cosmiche
Mick Chillage.about:
Lorenzo Montan and Mick Chillage are practically veterans across electronicas many-splendored plains these days, as both artists have been virtually inescapable these past few years. Both FAX alumni, with additional releases scattered across a worldwide range of labels, it was almost inevitable that the two should someday join forces. Deviazioni Cosmiche is the resulteight tracks of gripping, lovely starcrush and void descent, where both artists seamlessly merge their diverse intelligentsia to yield a powerful tour de force of synth structure.
Since each musicians back catalog has painted vivid pictures of brusque environments and alien topographies, this collaboration is no different, but what makes it a crowning achievement in their respective pantheons is the sheer dazzling display of sounds on hand. From the post-Vangelis be-bop of Vinctos Temporis to the spectral misty mountain climes of Microsopic+Mechanisms+Moon, the end result is a wonder to behold, full of towering peaks and abyssal valleys, hesitant percolations and demonstrative beatstorms. Begging for repeated listenings and multiple exposures, this one might well go down as a future classic of its form.
credits
released June 3, 2016
All tracks written and produced by Lorenzo Montan and Mick Chillage. Mastered by Lorenzo Montan.
US orders and downloads  carpesonum.bandcamp.com/album/deviazoni-cosmiche

trackinfo.title: The Last Pulse of the Universe

Mick Chillage.title: Devotology
Mick Chillage.about:
"Devotology" was originally released on Before & After Silence Recordings in late January 2024.
Devotology is the study of cosmic devotion, its role in the achievement of astrosis and devotional practice in Astronism.
"Devotology" was created between late 2022 and 2023. I initially composed and recorded "Polytheism" in December 2022 as a ten minute dark drone Ambient piece and returned to it a few months later and was inspired to add more synth parts and keys etc which progressed the track with a deeper spiritual or other worldly sensibility I bounced back and forth between other projects and built the final mix and arrangement knowing that it felt like the beginning of a possible theme.
Track three came next "Auroral Devotion" [but under a different working title] in April 2023 some random sound design experimentation lead me to the main shifting polyphonic pad drone, I kept doodling and experimenting with various other synths and played various parts until I arrived pretty quickly with part 1 of this piece.
I sensed that the track could be longer but I didn't want to just simply arrange the existing elements as they where so I got heavily into playing around with the source material which was purely analogue to began with.
I decided to explore within the digital realm to achieve an unusual mood and aesthetic for the second part that subtly mutates & drifts into other sonic dimensions.
The final piece to be recorded was track three "Sol" recored in late summer of 2023 which was inspired by the sound of my malfunctioning Solar panel pump system which was in need of a service. I climbed into my attic storage space with my Zoom H1 recorder and captured various cycles the pump was now making, these unusual sounds became drones and eerie mechanical pulses & clonks which where loped and manipulated in various ways. The addition of some poly synth parts, mono leads and FX added a more musical feel to the strange foundations.
The idea that this sound came from my solar panel system and basically the power of the sun made me think about our brightest star and how important it is for our existence and it led me to the concept of an album based on ancient and modern worship of celestial bodies in their many forms.
I saw a connection between the other tracks that somehow had a cosmic fascination and everything just fell into place it seemed.
credits

Mick Chillage.title: Distant Light
Mick Chillage.about:
"Distant Light" on CD is released on the Netherlands based
Databloem records label, The CD is almost sold out!
To purchase a CD or for more sonic explorations go to:  databloem.com
Irish based producer Mick Chillage delivers his final album of 2014 after his most prolific year to date with three albums focusing on his ambient work and one under his electro alias "The Shape". This time "Distant Light" displays a selection of tracks which explore a myriad of groove styles and electronic genres but with a heavy serving of his trade mark ambient textures, emotive melody and lush arrangements that moves between dark and light atmospheres, showcasing Mick's broad influences and production abilities. From the dub space techno of "Expect Delays" to the icy electro frequencies of "Polar Bytes" to the shimmering warmth of "Radiance", "Distant Light" is a sonic celebration of the wonders of the world around us and the mysteries of our universe and beyond.

Mick Chillage.title: Drone Ensembles
Mick Chillage.about:
In recent times I've become interested in the idea of tracks that are based around a foundation of sustained drones/textures, chords etc which are then layered with improvised keys, textures & melodies, found sounds etc but keeping a certain level of minimalism yet rich in atmosphere.
In early 2024 I began experimenting with tracks with this technique in mind & from time to time I would add tracks to a folder that I felt fitted the concept.
By late 2024 I pretty much had the bones of the album now presented to you, with a little bit of additional mixing in early 2025 and it was completed. I feel this a cohesive collection of deep yet atmospheric & emotive ambient works that explore different worlds & moods that goes beyond what the term "Drone" usually conveys.
The album includes a sequenced mix of all the tracks.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released June 26, 2025
Written, produced & mastered by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin between 2024 & 2025.
Original Photograph Cory Mills
Layout & Design by Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: E.I.M.
Mick Chillage.about:
E.I.M.(Experiments In Mono) was created in late jan 2020.
My goal was to experiment with just one Mono synth, in this case with just the Korg MS20 Mini, Korg's reproduction of the classic mono synth from the late 70's, famously used by just about everyone.
Playing around with various patching and front panel editing I would improvise on the keys, some parts musical and others very experimental. Once happy with each part I would then record into Ableton and eventually built it up to seven different audio parts stemming form just the MS20, each part is of different durations, causing some interesting evolving movements, rather than endless repeating 8 or 16 bar structures that are omni present in much of todays strictly structured electronic music.
The twin oscillators and the parallel High Pass and Low Pass filter with their own independent modulation controls, the MS20 sound can result in some very organic sounding tones. One element, sounds to me perhaps like the ghost of a jazz saxophonist jamming with the wild ring modulations while someone else plays a retro glitching Japanese computer game in a water filled cavern while a haunting synth lead joins in to add some further mystery.
However you the listener will interpret this cocktail of analogue sound and digital FX etc is up to you, but I do hope that it conveys something that can keep your attention and stirs something in your imagination for the almost one hour of its duration.
Mick Chillage May 2020
November 2024 I created a new 24bit master of both versions.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released May 7, 2020
Written, produced, mixed and mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin Ireland 2020
Photo; Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Early MC303 Tracks 1996 to 1998 Volume 1
Mick Chillage.about:
From the early nineties I dreamt of producing my own electronic music after hearing that acts like LFO, Orbital etc had produced much of their work from small bedroom studios. After much investigation in to the equipment they used, I realised that it would not be so cheap to obtain the equipment needed, at this time analogue synths were still the only way to create these sounds as digital synthesis seemed to be for experienced programmers.
It wasnt until the mid 90s that a new breed of digital kit started to emerge, gone were the unfathomable interfaces of the DX7 and the mega expensive sampling workstations like the Fairlight. Companies like Roland started to realise that musicians wanted the ease of use that analogue kit gave, plenty of knobs for instant real-time manipulation and control.
One piece of kit caught my eye, The Roland MC303, my understanding at the time was that this machine was part bass line emulator of Rolands classic TB303 acid box and their famous 909 and 808 drum machines. The price seemed reasonable, I thought great! I can learn how to program drums and play basslines etc and eventually progress to another synth for more sounds but when I got it home I discovered it had much more, Pianos, Strings, Pads, Leads, FX and an eight track sequencer!!
Out of the box and with a few days of getting to grips with its basics the MC303 was an instant dance music machine with some obvious trance/dance preset sounds and sequences, but if you dug a little deeper and avoided the presets other styles were possible.
Listening back I still get that sense of creative innocence within the compositions and production, maybe that was due to the MC303's limitations or my new found artistic endeavours? but I feel I its appropriate to pay respect to the little grey box that paved the way for many more budding producers in the mid to late nineties.

Mick Chillage.title: Early MC303 Tracks 1996 To 1998 Volume 2
Mick Chillage.about:
In March 2012 I released my Early MC303 Tracks 1996 to 1998 Volume One.A collection of tracks which showcased some of my early productions which covered many genres within the electronic music spectrum. For Volume One I mainly selected tracks from my minidisc recordings archive as many of the tracks were no longer stored on my MC303's memory. From these original recordings I edited and mastered them in Ableton live.
So after the success of Volume One, July 2012 will see the release of Volume Two. This time many of the tracks sequences were still contained within the MC303s memory so I was fortunate enough to be able to re-record many of the tracks into Ableton and mix and arrange within the program.
I have been very strict to not get lost using Abletons wide range of features and FX so I kept the tracks original feel by staying within the restriction of the MC303's architecture, so I only used the maximum of eight track sequencing, two simulataneous effects and low pass filters etc.. just like the MC303.
One or two of the tracks also feature the mighty Korg Prophecy
which I added to my set up in early 1998 but using the MC303 to sequence on one channel only due to the Prophecys monophonic and single timbral system.
Again it has been great fun revisiting these tracks and brings me back to a time when I was still listening to so much music and drawing inspiration from many genres which is clearly evident in both collections. Im still very proud of most these tracks and it is great to be able to release these early recordings finally, something that has been nagging in my conscience for many years.

Mick Chillage.title: Earth Spaces
Mick Chillage.about:
Earth Spaces was written & recorded through September & October of 2024. The six distinct Ambient/Environmental pieces were written in the order as they appear within the album.
A mixture of recent and old field recordings, various synthesisers, electro acoustic sound sources were utilised to create this work.
My goal was to create an album that reflected certain earthy environments & a diversity that our planet can offer but also something that went a bit beyond just sonic textural qualities & hopefully something that would offer a subtle musicality that would conjure certain emotions or trigger memories of places once visited or even creating imagined landscapes for the listener.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released December 12, 2024
Written, arranged, mixed & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin Ireland Autumn 2024.

Mick Chillage.title: Epinaz
Mick Chillage.about:
Upon the official release Bandcamp mentioned it in the "New & Notable" section.
What they said:
A superbly focused and experimental record, pulling together fresh takes on drone instrumentation into a compositionally complex and modern sound.

Mick Chillage.title: Expanse
Mick Chillage.about:
Expanse was created in May/June of 2024.
After spending a lot of time experimenting with my semi modular mono synths and the Korg sequencer on "In Sequence"
I felt I wanted to explore some deeper & layered soundscapes using my mighty Prophet Rev 2.
Starting out by creating stacked patches on the synth and performing them in a freeform way as much as possible I built up some deep shifting drone foundations with a rather expansive tonal quality. These elements naturally guided me to the rather dark & atmospheric yet mystical aesthetic, I was mindful of keeping the tracks sparse regarding the amount of additional elements I added to keep from getting too cluttered and to retain a sense of vastness and endless space.
I hope with the four tracks contained I have delivered something within the deeper side of Ambient, drone that stirs the imagination and the soul in some way.
Mick Chillage
June 2024

Mick Chillage.title: Expanse 2
Mick Chillage.about:
In June 2024 I released "Expanse" a four track Ambient album that was like a sonic snapshot of the vastness and wonderment of space.
I was very pleased how this album turned out and was still charged with inspiration to explore these themes in newer and different ways.
Late June I continued to work/experiment on some new pieces just to see where they could take me and I had not consciously decided to make a sequel but I guess subconsciously I was pulled back into the world of "Expanse"
By early July I had the bones of four new works that definitely fitted with the previous aesthetic but with a broader scope perhaps. Mid July I worked on the arrangements and mixes until I arrived at a destination that made me realise this was definitely a sequel to "Expanse"
I hope you enjoy this next journey into the Expanse!

Mick Chillage.title: Exulansis
Mick Chillage.about:
Exulansis...The tendency to give up trying to talk about an experience because people are unable to relate to it,whether through envy or pity or simple foreignness which allows music to drift away from the rest of your life story, until the memory itself feels out of place, almost mythical, wandering restlessly in the fog, no longer even looking for a place to land.
Mick Chillage presents us with ten pieces of music that clock in around 4 hours with additional remixes from Joel Tammik & Si Matthews and
Darren McClure
Exulansis was also released as a limited USB stick through  www.txtrecordings.co.uk
Mastering:  www.blackparticle.com/index.html
Artwork:  www.instagram.com/_ninrud/

Some years back I had the EP available on my bandcamp page in wav but removed it & now have decided to make it available again as I feel its an important release of my early discography.

Mick Chillage.title: FAXology
Mick Chillage.about:
"FAXology" was my debut for the legendary Fax records, home to some of the greatest names in electronica like Klaus Schulze, Biosphere, Ritchie Hawtin, Anthony Rother, Move D, and of course label boss Namlook himself and many many more.. As the title suggests "Faxology" is a collection of Fax inspired works and was released on the eve of the labels 20th anniversary.
Over the years "FAXology" has been falsely presumed & stated by some people online that the album was possibly created with the use of sound samples from various Fax releases or that Pete had commissioned the album to be created as an homage to his label.
All of the sounds and musical compositions were created from scratch on various synths & Pete was not aware of the album until the demo was sent to him. The album demo was untitled and after some lengthy discussions back and fourth Pete suggested "FAXology" as a title and I agreed.
Official release statement from Pete Namlook
www.namlook.de/infos/PS08122.html
"This is the debut of Mick Chillage on FAX. Pete Namlook: "When I first heard the demo I was blown away... I was wondering if this was a live show of Tetsu Inoue and me ..." so close and yet a very own creation of music that it totally reminds of the 90ies music that made FAX +49-69/450464 a trademark in Electronic Music. Right before the 20th anniversary this album came at the right time forming a great and fresh reminiscence of what for Pete is part of his past, present and future"
"FAXology" on CD has now become a rare Item with occasional copies popping up at ebay and discogs etc..
Graphics By Andre Ruello  www.flickr.com/photos/sansserifgrafik/
Dedicated to the memory of Peter Kuhlmann 1960 to 2012

trackinfo.title: Gamma Radiation [Extended Live Mix Previously Unreleased]

Mick Chillage.title: FAXology 2022
Mick Chillage.about:
This version was originally released through Before & After Silence Recordings in November 2022 on CD & digital.
In 2011 I fulfilled an artistic dream to release music through one of my most influential electronic artists Pete Namlook and his cult label Fax records, whom I'd been following/supporting passionately for almost 20 years.
In very early summer of 2011 I compiled a selection of tracks which I felt had a certain Fax aesthetic or influence yet had my own sonic feel, I nervously sent these to Pete.
He kindly messaged me and said he would listen within a few days, which he did. His response came something as a shock as he was really into the demo and wanted to release it within a month to wrap up his usual summer break.
Initially I was perhaps expecting that if he was to like it that he may suggest some additional changes like shorten some tracks or maybe such a track could benefit with another musical element or mix. Pete was ready to master the album straight away and I trusted his ears and impeccable taste that it was perfect as it was. I did not in anyway want to suggest that perhaps some additional time could be spent on one or two tracks incase I missed an opportunity to release on Fax records.
Pete and myself discussed some possible fitting titles, he had said that upon listening to it at first he felt it was like hearing a lost live recording that perhaps himself and Tetsu could have recorded yet it was something new also and it it felt like it was a glimpse of the past, the present and maybe the future of the Fax sound and as the twentieth anniversary was approaching this landed perfectly and Pete suggested "FAXology" and I sat with it for a day or two and it just seemed to fit with everything.
So, "FAXology" was released on Fax in June of 2011. it was my second full length CD album and it helped hugely with getting my name as an established Ambient/electronica artist.
Over the years I had contemplated a re-issue as original copies are rare and fetch collector prices on sites like Discogs etc. A version appeared on my 09-19 CD box set but it has not been available separately.
In 2020 I set up Before & After Silence Recordings and i had stated that I would reissue some albums "FAXology" was high on my list but in 2019 due to a violent thunderstorm my old laptop and connected hard drive suffered a catastrophic frying form lightning that struck the house.
I believed that all of the old project files were lost forever.
Cut to 2021 and during some renovations at the house I dug out an old box of cables and other old computer peripherals from my attic storage, in the bottom of the box there was a USB stick, curiously I plugged it in only to find a folder that read "Live sets" I opened it and there was pretty much all of the tracks from "FAXology" in a live session capacity.
Over the next few months I painstakingly reworked all of the tracks within Ableton to match the arrangements of the original CD but making some improvements to the overall mix, enhancing the stereo panning and movement, utilising individual effects for each channel as I now have a much more powerful Mac rather than using sends from two master effects channels. Some more subtle differences in the arrangements and use of filters etc.
Track four "Control Room" was always one I felt could have been expanded on, I like the original and its rather minimal feel but for the 2022 version I added some additional sparse sounds.
I still hold a huge lot of love for the original mix and master but wanted to give fans something a little more with this re-issue rather than just repressing it with the original wavs. I was fortunate to have Lorenzo Montana on mastering duties, Lorenzo whom is a brilliant solo artist but also worked close with Pete on the excellent Labyrinth series it felt right to have someone to sprinkle that final bit of sonic magic to this new mix of "FAXology"
Revisiting this album was a joy to rebuild and work on, I was careful to make the changes very subtle but hope that those who enjoy the original will find something new and enhanced that makes the listening experience all the more rewarding and also I hope that maybe a new audience will discover and enjoy it.
To Peter Kuhlmann I am eternally grateful.
Mick Chillage Dublin October 2022.

Mick Chillage.title: From Shores To Stars
Mick Chillage.about:
"From Shores To Stars" was initially conceived from a rather
Techno like progression I had created on the MS20 Mini back in April of 2020. I went back to it some days later and felt it had something more to it than just laying down some typical 909 grooves.
So I slowed the sequence down in pitch and added some High Pass Filter's with some modulation sweeps and various effects I duplicated the sequence and pitched it up some more to give some extra layers, it began to sound other worldly.
I returned to some experimentation with the MS20 and after some knob tweaking and patching I was surprised that I ended up with a somewhat human sounding tone, I played some notes and it sat well, adding a haunting quality, this sound is the introductory sound of the piece.
I then moved to the REV2 for some further inspiration a bit of tweaking and a bit of improvisation lead to a dreamy lead like passage. some high frequency random melodies were added to create, perhaps a twinkling of stars effect.
To the best of memory some white noise sweeps from the MS20 were created for the rumbling shore like sounds and then a subtle synth sequence to give it a bit of a retro Ambient touch.
All sounds created on two Analogue synths with some further editing and digital manipulation in Ableton live 10.
Recorded mixed and arranged and mastered in live 10.
January 2025 the track was given a new extended mix and 24Bit master

trackinfo.title: From Shores To Stars [2025 24Bit Remaster]

Mick Chillage.title: GMRV-2MS
Mick Chillage.about:
Its a beautiful weekend in late August 2020, I'm trying to relax
with some quiet peaceful music after a busy week at work.
My neighbours have other plans, to continue working on their new back garden patio, so the sound of a con-saw cutting through concrete has now become the soundtrack to this beautiful August weekend.
Not to let it ruin my weekend I decided to record the sounds emanating from the ongoing construction site with my zoom H1, I figured it may come in useful at some point.
A few days later, all is quiet and I decide to import and listen to the grinding and cutting of concrete. I drop the sound file into the sampler in Ableton and play around with loop points and pitches, filter etc, I find a pleasing sustained drone-like quality in a chord and the foundations were set for a possible new piece.
I started off playing some string like sounds on the Moog Grandmother.
Some more editing on the Moog Grandmother and I created a rather classic sounding Moog bass, patching the mod section into the noise generator to create a third oscillator, with a nice sustain and subtle sweeping filtering to add some movement on each note, I improvised a section and recorded it, I then pitched the midi up by 12 notes and had the Moog play the same section and then overdubbed the two parts to make a larger two note six oscillator Moog soundscape.
The prophet Rev2 is used for some polyphonic pad/string like sections.
From this point I edited and multi racked the Moog some more, creating various alien like modulated sounds that appear through out the track. The MS20 produced the almost creepy bird like sound that drifts in & out as the piece progresses.
Overall the track has a fairly dark ominous tone and feel. From about the thirty three minute mark a new Moog lead enters and adds a shift in mood somewhat which I felt was needed to make the track work over its almost sixty minute duration.
I hope this piece conjures places & spaces in your imagination and
gives you an hour of pure escapism to enjoy.
Mick Chillage Sept 2020.

Mick Chillage.title: Growth
Mick Chillage.about:
"Growth" was born from the inspiration of both nature and my synths.
On a recent walk around my local park and across its rather impressive yet brutal looking suspension footbridge which spans across the river below I noticed the growth of lichen on its fabricated structure, the bridge is only a few years old and I was taken by the bright yellow fungi contrasting against the wine coloured painted metal supports and the black slip resistant walk way, I felt this would make a nice photograph so I took a picture with my phone.
The image kinda lingered in my brain longer than I expected and I was fascinated how the lichen was taking over the bridge, almost as if it was trying to blend in the alien structure to its natural surroundings.
I began to see a connection between nature's ability to grow in the most unexpected environments and how growth can happen to us in unexpected situations, particularly poignant in the current pandemic we all find ourselves in, for many this has been a challenging time for sure but also its been a time of growth as we find new ways to cope and perhaps discover that maybe we should be doing things different in our lives.
The track itself, came about purely through experimenting with the Moog Grandmother initially, a random generative patch I created was the catalyst, by dialling various control knobs it created very varied and unexpected results, I also captured some drones that evolved from this patch and then built more synth parts from the Prophet Rev2, & the Supernova II, eventually the Moog elements became more like background effects and as the track comes to its final quarter I played some improvised keys using the Native Instruments Maverick Piano which I felt complimented some of haunting synth sounds.
The title "Growth" seemed to fit as the track grew from an unusual sonic foundation just like the lichen had grown on the metal of the very industrial and brutal looking footbridge at my park.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released November 5, 2020
Written, produced mixed & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin October 2020.
Photo & design: Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Growth
Mick Chillage.about:
Please Note! That both "Growth Pt1 & Pt2 were released individually digitally in 2020.
So check your digital collection to avoid duplication orders & also the same CD as released on Before & After Silence Recordings in October 2021.
October 2021 sees the release of Growth on CD & Digital.
The inspiration came about while on a walk around my local park and across its rather brutal looking metal suspension footbridge which spans across the river below. I noticed the growth of lichen on its surface. I was taken by the bright yellow fungi contrasting against the wine coloured painted metal supports and the black slip resistant walkway. I felt this would make a nice photograph, so I took a picture with my phone.
The image lingered in my brain and I was fascinated how the lichen was taking over the bridge on certain surfaces, almost as if it was trying to blend the alien structure to its natural surroundings.
I began to see a connection between nature's ability to grow in the most unexpected environments and how growth can happen to us in unexpected situations also, particularly poignant in the current pandemic, for many this has been a challenging time but also its been a time of growth as we discover that maybe we should be doing things different in our lives.
This inspired me to work on a new piece of music.
The title "Growth" seemed to fit as the track grew from an unusual sonic foundation just like the lichen had grown on the metal of the very industrial and brutal looking footbridge at my park.
Growth Part 2 came shortly after the first one, although a completely new composition it seemed to connect with the first one, another recent walk in my park and I noticed that one of the trees had a very tiny branch growing, on this infantile branch were some rather large new leaves. Strangely this was Autumn and whilst most leaves were dying these leaves were very green & luscious. I took a photo and some days later a new piece of music began to emerge.
So now I present Growth Parts 1 & 2 on one CD for the first time and in digital that clocks in at approximately seventy eight minutes.
Mick Chillage October 2021

Written, produced, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Growth Pt.2
Mick Chillage.about:
Growth 2 came shortly after the first one, although a completely new composition it seemed to resonate with the first one and on another recent walk in my local park I noticed that one of the trees had a very tiny branch growing and on this very delicate and infantile branch were some rather large leaves already, also this was Autumn and while most leaves were dying these leaves were very green & luscious. I took a photo and some days later a new piece of music began to emerge.
On this occasion the process was a little different. I started off late one night with the first improvised piano section that arrives later in the piece, I saved it and returned the following day. I knew it needed something as a foundation, i played around with some ambient chords on the Prophet rev2 editing the sounds, strangely the first piece I played seemed to compliment the piano musically and in tone.
I then felt it needed something to bring more dynamic range and a further feeling, something that wasn't quite of this world or mysterious, further editing of some bell like tones and some extreme filtering and playing similar notes that matched the piano passage but at much higher octaves.
I had this feeling that the piece would need something that swells and grows at some point in the track, I created a modulated drone with some shifting of keys but processed the sound further with some subtle overdrive & volume and rising reverb etc at perhaps the three quarter point in the album.
I also turned to the Moog Grandmother and created a three oscillator pad patch with a haunting quality where I played another improvised section which arrives later, towards the end a new piano piece emerges a mixture of chords and individual notes along with some additional synth elements to gently wrap it up in a new direction to perhaps reflect a change a new life emerging in an unexpected place or way.

Mick Chillage.title: Harmonic Connections
Mick Chillage.about:
At the start of 2017, Mick Chillage released "Exulansis"
A lengthy voyage exploring a vast sonic landscape that is
Ambient music.
At the start of 2018, Mick returns to txt with "Harmonic Connections"
something of a departure from "Exulansis" showcasing his passion and ability to blend and mix many genres within the electronic music sphere.
From the spacious grandeur of "Beyond the Infinite" to the soulful
Detroit Techno strains of "Art Of Symmetry" the acid-tinged "Room 303" echoes and pays a little respect to the Berlin School experimentalism of the 70's yet keeps its feet firmly in the 21st century.
"Harmonic Connections" reveals a connection in the cosmos, nature and music and is a glimpse of Mick's vast musical influences from soundtracks to ambient and experimental electronica that effortlessly connects with moments of IDM and Techno rhythms, often melancholic and equally optimistic "Harmonic Connections" looks to the past and the future with a rich sonic tapestry.

Mick Chillage.title: Hiraeth [Support For Ukraine]
Mick Chillage.about:
Hiraeth is a Welsh word that has no direct English translation, likens it to a homesickness tinged with grief and sadness over the lost or departed.
Personally I would consider myself to be apolitical and generally I am not one for expressing my opinions about situations that arise which I feel are beyond my scope of truly knowing all of the facts.
However, when innocent people are thrown into a war it greatly sadness and angers me. The sense of helplessness is overwhelming, knowing that as one person, nothing I say or do can make a difference in changing the personal plight of so many, yet the sad irony is that it's usually one person who creates such awful plight for so many and the innocent on both sides ultimately suffer.
Watching the events in Ukraine unfold on media as families are forced to leave behind loved ones, the homes, the lives, the communities they've built and not knowing if they may ever see such precious and deeply valued parts of their lives again is something I cannot even begin to comprehend.
I began to think of ways I could perhaps help by utilising my artistic gifts?
So, I thought to myself that the next piece of music that I create I will donate all profits to the much-needed aid support agencies. Maybe pick two key agencies and split the profits between them.
The artistic challenge was how do I even begin to convey all the emotions that come with such a scale of human tragedy in a single piece of music?
I kept coming back to the emotions of leaving a life behind, loved ones and close friends a country you loved, your home as it gets destroyed and so much more.
I started with a blank canvas over the weekend and created some dark and ominous layered drones as a starting point, there's rather unsettling low frequency undercurrent that runs through the piece which suggest a sense of uncertainty and fear but as it progresses more tones and shifting pads & string elements rise and fall which I hope creates an important sense of hope.
I recorded a live take and then mixed and arranged it into what is now a long-form Ambient piece which is very much in my own personal style of expression and I hope that I have created something that conveys the human side of this tragedy and that you my valued supporters may wish to contribute to my gesture of giving something to those who need it very much right now.
I'm aware that I'm a niche artist but I'm happy that I can make some little difference through the help of my valued follower's & supporters.
I'm setting the track at 3.00 or name your price.
I will keep you all up to date on sales made and provide screenshots of both sale reports from Bandcamp and then most importantly the donation receipts.
Any support will be greatly appreciated!
Mick

Mick Chillage.title: In Sequence
Mick Chillage.about:
"In Sequence" is the result of various experimentations mainly utilising the Korg Sq1 Sequencer along with the Moog Grandmother, the Korg MS20 Mini & the Deopfer MS-404 which are all analogue mono synths.
I would create various patches and then set to work creating sequences on the SQ1 often getting the SQ1 to have all of the synths running at the same time and capturing a live jam through my mixing desk for several minutes while manipulating and altering each synth on the fly.
Other moments would involve capturing just one synth sequence and then over dubbing another completely different sequence over it, often repeating this process a few times until I felt I had a strong musical idea.
In some cases performing some polyphonic parts on the Prophet Rev2 along with some programmed poly rhythms of various genre styles also once recorded each audio part may have been further edited in the digital world & of course additional FX and mixing and arrangement until I had a piece that felt complete as a track rather than just an on the fly jam.
I deviated with my sonic tools on "Sequence Pt.3" where I returned solely to my Waldorf Pulse 2 which I had not used in some time this gave me a burst of fresh inspiration and one of the sequences is maybe reminiscent of synth part used on Herbie Hancock's "Rain Dance" from his legendary "Sextant" album, this was not intentional but I was pleased to create a similar aesthetic & sequence by accident which was originally created on a Arp 2600 back in 1972.
Overall the tracks contained explore various themes & genres from Berlin School, 90s electronica, Techno, Experimental IDM & Ambient to Jungle etc as I really wanted to explore what was possible with one sequencer and limited semi modular analogue synths/standard synths.

Mick Chillage.title: Integration Loops
Mick Chillage.about:
Like many of my works "Integration Loops" was born from a moment
of pure inspiration, I was working on a project which seemed to be a little stagnant and I wandered off playing something completely different when a sound from another project caught the attention of my ears and senses again.
I played some improvised keys, which is pretty much the foundation of the track, I liked its haunting sound, although purely electronic it has a somewhat organic tone, almost human like at times, something that my Prophet Rev2 delivers from time to time.
With this longish improvised phrase recorded I began to play yet another deeper counterpoint with a new sound patch which I edited to match the duration of the very first improvisation. The two of these pieces seemed to just sit together so nicely I kinda sat and listened as they both looped endlessly but each pass seemed to grow and shift in different ways to my ears, delivering a certain emotion that resonated with me.
I kinda felt that these two elements could perhaps just play for an hour or so, with subtle filtering and volume changes and various effects being tweaked also, a fairly minimal emotive track but experimental with its long running time.
But as I prepared to arrange these, I couldn't help but delve further into more sound design and improvisation. I worked solidly for the rest of the evening, adding more elements but being careful not to clutter each part.
I now felt I had the sonic ingredients for a long form track but maybe this time I could push it out further, utilising the freedom that the digital format can offer and going beyond the maximum eighty minutes constraints of my beloved CD format.
The following day, I began to mix & arrange the track and what you hear now was all pretty much conceived in just under two days. I hope I've achieved something that can keep a listener engaged for it's duration as it gradually morphs from emotive swells to calming, softer plaintive moments and to ghostly tones that appear briefly and to disappear into the almost endless sonic haze.
"Integration Loops" clocks in at one and a half hours, and yes the title is kind of a homage to a particular well know Ambient series ;)
Equipment used:
Prophet Rev2 16 Voice. (All sound sources)
Ableton Live 10. Effects, digital processing, mixing, arranging.
Native Instruments "The Maverick" virtual piano.
Written & Recorded September 2022 at the Igloo Dublin.
Remastered in 24Bit February 2026

Mick Chillage.title: Inter-Dimensional Guidance
Mick Chillage.about:
Inter-Dimensional Guidance was written & recorded in Autumn of 2022, it was one of those albums that seemed to arrive almost out of nowhere.
Most of the time when I create music I prefer to start with a blank canvas with no real preconceived idea of what I want to achieve. The title track started out as just an experiment with my Moog Grandmother, creating drones that shift in tone by using the modulation matrix and the mod wheel to accurately achieve the desired tone and add movement.
Once I had arrived at the various desired drones I captured these in audio and then I instinctively edited and played what you hear as the track progresses.
The title track was pretty much written arranged and recorded over two nights, this was definitely the impetus to an unaware trajectory of creativity that continued over the following two weeks or so where the four following tracks emerged and I began to realise that a potential thematic album had emerged, almost as if I had been guided by an unknown outside force.
The themes within the album appear to be somewhat mysterious, otherworldly and perhaps those that explore other dimensions and spaces. It's strange that this album came together just as I was ready to release the newly mixed version of my FAXology album, is "Inter-Dimensional Guidance" the result of a subconscious desire to fulfil an often requested sequel to the album FAXology?
Maybe or maybe not.
Either way I hope you enjoy my latest deep & explorative album!
Mick Chillage
February 2023
