Mick Chillage.title: Jouhatsu
Mick Chillage.about:
July 2021 sees the fourth release on Before & After Silence Recordings.
Jouhatsu (Japanese: , "evaporation") or johatsu refers to the people in Japan who purposely vanish from their established lives without a trace. However this phenomenon can be seen all over the world.
A recent conversation with a friend on social media led me to a documentary on Youtube which focused on the culture which is prevalent in Japan, it followed various peoples stories;
Those who have arranged their own evaporation and those who are searching for missing loved ones, I found these accounts to be incredibly sad yet fascinating, that in this modern
age of information that someone could start a completely new life without a trace.
This phenomenon of Jouhatsu resonated with me & various tracks that I composed after viewing the documentary seemed to be of a similar tone/emotion, almost reflecting what It must be like for those forced into such drastic measures to leave a life & loved ones behind, to start again and also not forgetting the turmoil & anguish of those left in the dark regarding the whereabouts of someone... more
credits

Written, produced, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin spring 2021
Graphic design by Tony Obr.

Mick Chillage.title: Koromebi
Mick Chillage.about:
Koromebi.
In real life, the space between the canopy and branches allows sunlight to gently filter through. In Japan, the dappled light this creates is called komorebi (pronounced koh-mo-reh-bee) and is made up of the kanji characters for tree (), shine through (), and sun ().
In late Decemeber of 2021 while on a countryside walk on an incredibly still day I came across a very peaceful mini forest that still had much of the fallen leaves from Autumn carpeting the forest floor.
The sun was low and the radiant beams of light really enhanced the already rich palette of vibrant tones at my feet.
I rested on a heavy fallen branch and sat for maybe thirty minutes as the sunlight crept between the trees.
That night I had an inspired moment, the music that developed is at first quite still/calm and gradually it shifts in tone & colour over its thirty minute duration.
The next day as I listened back to what I had written, it sort of felt as if I had composed a sonic snapshot of that peaceful thirty minutes in the forest.

Mick Chillage.title: Lethe [River Of Forgetfulness]
Mick Chillage.about:
In Classical Greek, the word lethe () literally means "oblivion", "forgetfulness", or "concealment".[3] It is related to the Greek word for "truth", aletheia (), which through the privative alpha literally means "un-forgetfulness" or "un-concealment".
Lethe was written and recorded in mid March 2022.
The initial inspiration came from a found sound experiment, the bubbling water sound that runs as a foundation through the duration of the track. Originally the water recording was pretty pedestrian, an everyday sound that I had to manipulate to create a feeling of perhaps being submerged or sinking in a deep cavernous body of water.
This led me to my Rev2 synth for all of the other elements, experimenting/editing with various patches trying to complement the deep aquatic found sound.
Fortunately the track came together within an evening and with some further mixing and arranging I ended up with a somewhat immersive dark long form Ambient track.
Mick Chillage
March 2022

released March 31, 2022
Written, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin.

Mick Chillage.title: Lowest Forms
Mick Chillage.about:
"Lowest Forms" was written in February of 2020 which utilises some very low frequency square & pulse waves, courtesy of the MS20 Mini with various modulation and improvised melodic and melancholic synth leads and some subtle and somewhat haunting polyphonic undercurrents and occasional slow motion caustic beats which fade in and out over its almost 60 minute duration..
Note: The bass on this mix is very low at times, some adjustment of your bass levels maybe recommended depending on your tastes and speaker set up.
I've also included an Ambient mix, where I have mixed the bass somewhat lower in volume and re-arranged the track and also added an additional subtle sonic element where the beats are in the Caustic Mix Version are removed.
Lowest Forms got a new mix & 24 Bit Master in December 2024
The [Alt Ambient Mix] has some new arrangement & sound additions.

Mick Chillage.title: Lowest Forms 2
Mick Chillage.about:
"Lowest Forms 2" was created in early March 2020.
I had no intention of making a follow up. I was mainly experimenting with my newly acquired Moog Grandmother and had created these interesting and haunting bell like tones. I also played around with some poly sounds on Prophet Rev2 and felt I was going in the right direction with a deep yet evolving ambient track. I then turned the MS20 mini and got this simple yet super low bass with some modulation that rises and falls, I recorded it and it seemed to fit as a really nice undercurrent.
The bass takes a while for it to appear in the track as it was pretty much the last element added.
"Lowest Forms 2" may have a theme similar to the original "Low Bass" and "Ambient" sounds but both are very distinct tracks.. Hope you enjoy!!
January 2025 "Lowest Forms 2" got a new 24Bit mix & master.

Mick Chillage.title: (M)odes
Mick Chillage.label: Carpe Sonum Records
Mick Chillage.about:
Mick Chillage could very well be the hardest working man in electronica, taking the reins of that position from the late Pete Namlook. What is more startling about the seemingly large quantity of work available from him in the past few years (and upcoming as well) is the high level of quality control he maintains throughout; nary a note is ill-placed, misaligned, or wasted. Chillages working methods are efficient to say the least, exemplary to say the most; the consummate musician, hes not one to sit still or allow his muse to stagnate, equally at home channelling any number of sub-genres, be it fleet electro or galvanizingly intense atmospherica.
His latest for Carpe Sonum after the wonderful Saudade release finds the erstwhile sonic frontiersman alternating a beautifully involving series of tracks that deftly straddle spheres both inner and outer. (M)odes paints Chillage as introspective, questing, soul-searching; the plaintive piano chords and twinkling synths of Nicos Gate suggest ancient rituals of deep contemplation, a re-examining of spiritualism as much as a vault heavenwards across the stars. The paragon of beauty that is Midnight Mist illustrates precisely what Chillage does best, digging down into the circuitboards of his trusty synths to exact the revealing science of gods. Its at once splendorous and awe-inspiring to behold, (M)odes of (in)alienation as gripping as they come.

Mick Chillage.title: Marius Regio
Mick Chillage.about:
September 2023 sees me returning to my ambient works after the previous two releases which explored Techno, Electro, IDM under my Initial Programs alias and varied Breakbeat excursions with "Amen Forms"
The title track "Marius Reigo" was created in July of 2023.
The track at its core has a haunting sonic foundation, yet as the track progresses new tones and moods shift in & out. As I worked on the piece various concepts and ideas happened quickly.
With just utilising my Prophet Rev2 I was able to achieve the right aesthetic which feels like observing another world while receiving various signals from an array of hi tech instruments, some sounds are alien and mysterious others are calming and familiar.
I hope that all of these morphing and layered elements make its forty minute duration a deep and engaging listen.
Its companion "Ganymede" recorded in Early September and has a darker atmospheric feel from the outset with its deep shifting analogue synth drones and its mysterious chimes and mutated alien chatter which comprises of a mixture of field recordings found sound and analogue synth experimentation and improvisation.
This album is dedicated to the memory of Andew Hartnett.
Andrew, along with his brother Dave were behind Dublin's cult XFM radio station. I'm eternally grateful for your kind friendship, shared talents, passions and your valuable time which you so generously shared during those fond early days.
Rest in peace Andrew.

Mick Chillage.title: Meditations
Mick Chillage.about:
Over the years I have received some very nice emails that my music has been an affective tool for some of my listeners with their particular mediative practices & sleep issues.
Although meditation is something I had never practiced myself I often felt that the creative process was a similar experience in that your focus goes away the from endless stream of thought often negative and it worked as an escape from my often over working mind.
In recent times I have had some struggles and challenges which had become amplified after a severe head injury and I really needed something to help with the rather slow & fluctuating recovery.
In the past I had tried to meditate but found it very difficult and didn't receive the desired results from these attempts, this was probably mainly due to my lack of understanding in the mechanics and a lack of belief in the process.
Recently while watching some David Lynch related videos on youtube I found out that the much loved movie writer & director was a advocate of a particular kind of mediation. I found this fascinating as I find him to be a super interesting human on a creative, philosophical, & spiritual level.
A sixteen minute video of him explaining his particular practice made total sense to me and it gave me a new perspective & decided to attempt some sessions with a new found enthusiasm.
www.youtube.com/watch?v=Em3XplqnoF4&t=2s
Within a few days I began to feel some benefits of this, however the mind mantra wasn't the most fitting for me and decided to try with just sound which I felt worked better and less distracting.
From this experience I decided that maybe it would be a good idea to create my own meditation sound works that I could tailor make to fit the desired 15 to 20 minutes or so that most people find the most suitable duration for meditative sessions.
I was mindful that these works needed to be minimal & not suggest any particular feelings or thoughts but needed some movements that you could focus on and follow. I just used my Prophet Rev2 Synthesiser and started with a raw two oscillator patch and edited from these until I had a sound that I felt would work well with sustained notes firstly and then some gentle shifting repeating/alternating chords that could be gently manipulated via filters, modulation & subtle effects over varying times.
While I have not studied the science of frequencies that may work best I just followed my ears based on what I consider calming sound and notes.
There a four pieces to use or choose from and I hope that at least one of these may work for meditative purposes or at least as a sonic backdrop to aid a sense of calm and relaxation & maybe even aid sleep.
I'm offering these pieces free as a Thank you for all of the very kind support wonderful feedback that has inspired me to continue with my music creation over the years.
Mick Chillage
March 2024

Written & produced by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin

Mick Chillage.title: Mirrors
Mick Chillage.about:
Mirrors is Mick Chillage's first full length album of 2020
all tracks were recorded in 2019 and follows after his "Epinaz"
album but leaves the beat orientated moments behind.
"Mirrors" explores a wide beat-less sonic terrain from the
galactic expanses of "Promise Of Stars" & "Uduzax" to the
Haunting melancholic minimalism of "Early Rise" to the emotional
reflective charm of "Mirror of Me" & the Melodramatic layers of "Torn"
Mirrors shows Mick's more personal side and conveys emotions
and atmospheres that sit effortlessly together that should resonate
with listeners both new and old to the ever expanding "Ambient" music genre.

Mick Chillage.title: Moog's, Moods & Memories
Mick Chillage.about:
For many years I've wanted a Moog synth in some form, however many of the newer models felt a little unlike the originals from the innovative days of the synth giant.
In the beginning of 2020 finally I decided to purchase the Moog Grandmother a semi modular synth that looked and felt like it could have been released in the early 1970s, its digital side is almost hidden to the eye, just basic midi implantation via USB and no preset/patch storage, just a raw patchable synth with some of the original module components of their classic modulars of their pioneering days. This had the heritage and hands on approach and sound I had dreamed of and I was not disappointed.
So I began to experiment with the Moog on various evenings and weekends, at times recreating sounds that sounded just like some of the tones on the Dark Side Of The Moog series and many more classic albums. I would often get goosebumps hearing these classic Moog sounds, just by dialing some of the control knobs and some basic cable patching, this would often result in some awesome inspirational sound!
I would immediately jam with the sounds that inspired me and just record long improvised passages, more editing and more playing and recording, multi tracking until I had the foundation of a track. Often the bones of a piece could happen in a few hours and the next day I would mix and arrange a finished piece in a digital environment. The Moog became very intuitive quickly and also led me to sound creation I never expected from Grandmother.
I guess it's safe to say I never truly set out to make a Moog themed album, there are also some of my other synths used where I needed some polyphonic sounds. Many pieces had come together very quickly and I just placed them in an unreleased folder as I usually do, eventually going through the various tracks and selecting ones that make a coherent listen or experience and the ones I chose just seemed to connect in a way that felt right for a new album.
During this period with the Moog I was in various states of mood and some sounds triggered certain memories, hence the title.
Moog's Moods & Memories was released on CD through Neo Tantra Recordings
in Autumn 2020.

Mick Chillage.title: Morphogenic Realities
Mick Chillage.about:
Morphogenic Realities was written and recorded over the space of two days in early August of 2021. The four tracks are based around a foundation of field recordings which have been looped, pitched and effected in various ways.
Various synth drones, pads & improvised keys etc tell distinct sonic narratives which should keep the listener engaged during its forty minute plus duration.
The album is offered in sequenced form or individual tracks for purchase.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released September 16, 2021
Written, produced & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin.
Design: Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Morphogenic Realities 2
Mick Chillage.about:
The first Morphogenic Realities was written and recorded over the space of two days in early August of 2021. The four tracks are based around a foundation of field recordings which have been looped, pitched and effected in various ways.
Various synth drones, pads & improvised keys etc tell distinct sonic narratives which should keep the listener engaged during its forty minute plus duration.
I wasn't initially planning to make a sequel or series as such but in January of 2025 over the space of a few days I had a very creative streak & the bones of four new tracks emerged rather organically.
Sonically the tracks reminded me of the very open to interpretation aesthetics of the first, although no field recordings are utilised on part 2, mainly synths & occasional found sounds. The rain forest like sound for example on "Virtual Nature" was created by digitally manipulating wildly modulated oscillators recorded via the Moog grandmother.
I decided to complete the tracks as a follow up to the original, making sure each piece had its own strong identity that conjured different worlds, dimensions & mind states.
I hope you enjoy the four new pieces of Morphogenic Realities 2.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released May 15, 2025
Written, composed, arranged & mixed & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo in winter of 2025.
Original photo Cory Mills.
Thank you Cory for sharing all of your wonderful images.
Art & layout Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Morphogenic Realities 3
Mick Chillage.about:
The third and final album in the series, "Morphogenic Realities 3" see's me explore more diverse & deep ambient atmospheres, emotions, moods & soundscapes.
Recorded through Spring of 2025 a similar work aesthetic was utilised as with the other but each piece has a distinct sonic character & mood.
I hope you enjoy this last in the series of Morphogenic Realities!
Mick Chillage.credits:
released July 24, 2025
Written, produced & mastered at the Igloo Dublin
by Michael Gainford 2025
Original photo By Cory Mills
Layout by Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: MS-V-MS
Mick Chillage.about:
MS-V-MS was created back in late December of 2019.
It started out using just two analogue mono synths and
the Prophet Rev2. The MS-404 by Doepfer which you can hear
on the intro with its spaced out 303 style acid tones.
I then added some haunting poly pads, thanks to the mighty Prophet Rev2. as the track progressed I decided to add some programmed drums, heavily edited and effected, causing some Heavy distorted industrial like tones.
The Korg MS20 mini appears, as a counterpoint in the track or mood change with a rather dark and large two oscillator pad sound which I coaxed out of the mono synth after some editing.
The greatest challenge was seeing if I could make this piece work
as a long form track with the fairly sparse number of tracks and elements.
I jammed with the elements live first to see how each movement, drum part and tweak-able parameters at hand would work, the piece kinda took on a life of its own.
So what you hear now is almost 60 minutes of a live arrangement which was then edited to remove some moments that either got too loud or perhaps a little cluttered.
I hope you enjoy my venture into Acid, Ambient, IDM and Industrial noise.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released April 9, 2020
Written, produced, arranged and recorded by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin Ireland December 2019.
Mastered by Michael Gainford
Photo by Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: MS-V-MS
Mick Chillage.about:
Late April 2021 saw the third release on Before & After Silence Recordings MS-V-MS
MS-V-MS was created back in late December of 2019 & released digitally in 2020. The track has been revisited for the 2021 release with some edits and arrangements & the addition of two new tracks that compliment the main long form piece.
MS-V-MS sees Mick exploring a tapestry of spaced out Acidic synth lines, haunting Ambient tones that shift & morph into passages of dark ominous analogue swells & Intricate poly rhythms with a driving industrial presence. Resulting in a flowing synergy of IDM intensity & otherworldly ambience.
The title track started out using just two analogue mono synths The Korg MS20 Mini & the Doepfer MS-404 hence the title. Other synths & various production techniques were used to complete the piece.
released April 27, 2021
Written, produced, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin 2020/2021

Mick Chillage.title: Night Works [Special Edition]
Mick Chillage.about:
This album is formatted for a gapless audio experience..
Night Works conveys a range of emotions that the closing twilight hours can often bring. Deep soundscapes shift like moonlight as shadows in darkness crawl across a lost landscape. Occasionally theres a sense of melodic comfort, like being cocooned in the warm atmosphere of your own home while some moments invite you to venture outside to witness the nocturnal activities of a vast darkness. Like a storm from nowhere, strange unidentified frequencies emerge in the distance and converse like a room of spirits that echo the sound of past nightmares. Glimmers of light appear as cities dream of hi rise sunsets.

Mick Chillage.title: Nocturnes Resonatiae
Mick Chillage.about:
"Nocturnes Resonatiae" was created in early November 2020.
the inspiration came from experimenting with the Moog Grandmother
very late at night. Through various patching and tweaking a rather bell like tone emerged from the synth I played some various notes and added reverbs & delays it seemed to feel like distant yet eerie church like bells ringing in the distance.
This lead me to experimenting further with my two poly synths the Prophet Rev 2 where I found another sharper bell like tone, some further editing lead me to a more distinct ringing sound, I played some improvised keys and captured a passage that complimented the eerie Moog elements.
Some more polyphonic moments from the Supernova II added a moody sustained string like section and a rather ominous deep sustained bass drone that you feel as much as you hear. other elements, strange modulated Moog & Korg MS20 added further mysterious tones with subtle movements.
I feel the piece conjures the early hours of a still night, perhaps in a city and the various mysterious sounds that emanate in the distance or right where you sleep as various devices continue to function through the night.
This piece is open to the imagination of you the listener in whatever way you want to interpret it.
Mick Chillage November 2020
In April 2025 the track was given a new extended mix
Mick Chillage.credits:
released November 19, 2020
Written, mixed, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin late at night November 2020
New extended mix April 2025
Artwork: Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Oceanus Procellarum
Mick Chillage.about:
Oceanus Procellarum was written and produced in October of 2022.
It was the second piece "Gravitational Anomalies" that was created first by using just the Moog Grandmother, creating the trippy bass sequence first and then the improv synth lead. The track sat on my hard drive for a week or so as an unfinished idea sketch.
A few days later from a patch creating exercise on my Prophet Rev2 I created an interesting deep pad with shifting filter frequencies, I played two separate pieces using the newly created sound that worked as a dark shifting atmosphere.
Other sounds developed and there seemed to be a relationship of dark and light, with the right arranging and placing of the various elements all with slightly different bar durations over time, all of these musical motif's will interplay with one another and create new subtle counterpoints yet retain its overall mood, so hence a track for a long form experience hopefully.
Once the piece was finished, I felt the other Moog based sketch may fit with a theme that sort harks back to the more hypnotic style of Ambient electronica of the early to mid 90's also with hints of 70's style Berlin School.
So, I retuned to "Gravitational Anomalies" with a mindset to make it more hypnotic/atmospheric and also introduce some downtempo polyrhythms, in a sort of downtempo breakbeat style but with a somewhat experimental minimalistic feel.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released October 20, 2022
Written, produced & mastered by Michael Gainford at the Igloo
Dublin October 2022
Art & layout Michael Gainford

trackinfo.title: Oceanus Procellarum
trackinfo.about:
Oceanus Procellarum was written and produced in October of 2022.
It was the second piece that was created first by using just the Moog Grandmother, creating the trippy bass sequence first and then the improv synth lead.
it sat on my hard drive for a week or so as an unfinished idea sketch.
A few days later from a patch creating exercise on my Prophet Rev2 I created an interesting deep pad with shifting filter frequencies, I played two separate pieces that worked as a dark shifting atmosphere.
Other sounds developed and there seemed to be a relationship of dark and light with the right arranging and placing of the various elements all with slightly different bar durations. Over time, all of these musical motif's will interplay with one another and create new counterpoints yet retain its overall mood, so hence a perfect track for a long form experience hopefully.
Once the piece was finished, I felt the other Moog based sketch may fit with a theme that sort harks back to the more hypnotic style of Ambient electronica of the early to mid 90's.
So, I retuned to "Gravitational Anomalies" with a mindset to make it more hypnotic and also introduce some downtempo polyrhythms, in a sort of Hip Hop style but with a somewhat experimental minimalistic feel.

Mick Chillage.title: Ophiuchi
Mick Chillage.about:
Ophiuchi was created in early July of 2022 and sees me exploring deep Ambient soundscapes that also incorporate an experimental Techno/IDM feel with subtle shifting beat motifs that arrive at the halfway point of this long form track.
Ophiuchus (/fijuks/) is a large constellation straddling the celestial equator. Its name comes from the Ancient Greek  (ophiokhos), meaning "serpent-bearer", and it is commonly represented as a man grasping a snake.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released July 7, 2022
Written & Produced & mastered by Michael Gainford
at The Igloo Dublin Ireland.
Photography Cory Mills
Design layout Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: Orphaned Tracks Vol 6
Mick Chillage.about:
It has been almost two years since the last "Orphaned Tracks" compilation and roughly about six months ago I began to realise that I had another collection of tracks I liked very much that didn't quite fit with certain albums or some sketches/ideas that I needed to return to.
Most of the pieces contained within Volume 6 are relatively recent and are from the last few years with two exceptions. With most of them I had to return to and add additional elements, create more refined arrangements and better mixes to make sure I had the best quality representation of each piece.
I hope you enjoy this latest volume of Orphaned tracks
Mick Chillage.credits:
released October 26, 2023
All tracks written arranged, mixed and mastered by Michael Gainford
Between 2005 & 2023
Photo and layout by Michael Gainford.

trackinfo.title: Sentimental Data [2021]
trackinfo.about:
This track began as a piece with a collaboration in mind back in 2021.
However the project was put on hold and I left the track unfinished
for some time. Eventually I decided to return to it and keep it minimal as I felt it had a fairly strong melodic identity. I added some additional beats in 2023 and mixed and arranged it for this comp in Oct 2023.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Hours [2005/2023]
trackinfo.about: Originally a piece I had roughly recorded way back in the mid naughties and had almost forgotten about. Rediscovered in 2022 on my old hard drive I returned to it although some drum elements were missing I had to reconstruct from memory what was there originally but I believe my new drum components and mix and arrangement have now improved the track to a place were I feel I reached my initial hopes.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Liquid Sequence [2020]
trackinfo.about: Initially born from a long take sequence I recorded using my MS20 and my SQ1 sequencer in 2020, this element sat for a while and on a random sweep through my unfinished projects one night I added the synth pad/voice section and some drums. Some more time passed and in September 2023 I returned to it and added additional elements, drum parts FX and bass etc. A mix and arrangement was completed in Oct 2023.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: State Zero [2019]
trackinfo.about:
A random exercise in some drum programming one night quickly lead me to editing the synth sequence using my Prophet synth which seemed to sit very nicely with the simple drums. I returned to it some nights later and was inspired with the silky synth lead I performed as an improvised session, some parts didn't work so well and I edited those out and re arranged the lead section.
Further manipulation or the two main parts and additional drums came later. This track was completed in the spring of 2023.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Secret Garden (Featuring: Kitty B Vocals) [2012]
trackinfo.about:
This track is has been floating around for many years now and is a personal favourite. Over the years I've delved into some Dub influenced tracks either in Techno, Downtempo or Ambient. This piece kinda sits within all of these genres.
I had the foundation of this track completed and felt it needed something else, I reached out to an old friend of mine Kitty whom I knew had a wonderful voice, singing in choirs, worked with Irish dub artists etc.
I sent her the instrumental and she came over to my home studio and pretty much laid down the ethereal and soulful vocal textures in one take.
The track also features some dialogue from a particular underground movie which adds a another emotion and dynamic to it.
All synths, basses and drums are played and performed by myself.
I was always hoping that this would sit within a particular project but always felt it kinda stood out on its own, finally its time to share with the world after some ten plus years.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Blossom [2018]
trackinfo.about:
This track was an experiment when I purchased the Native Instruments Session Strings. I wanted to see if I could compose/arrange a somewhat orchestral piece although with no proper theory in such things it may not be what is possible with what a real live string ensemble can do.
Overall I was quite happy with the end result, I spent quite few nights arranging and mixing it. There is also some subtle synth ambience textures in the mix here and there.
I enjoyed making this track but I doubt scoring this kind of music for film would be an area I would be successful in unless I studied this are in more depth.
I now occasionally use the Session strings vary sparingly on some of my other ambient pieces etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Brittle Skies [2022].
trackinfo.about: This is another piece I had started with the intention of it being for a collaboration project but somehow I found it hard to hold back and was deeply inspired and continued to work away and eventually realising I pretty much had a finished track that left little or no room for my collaborator.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Techquinox [2022]
trackinfo.about: The opening sequence on this track was initially intended to be the start of an ambient track but the path of inspiration took me elsewhere. What I ended up with is a fairly intense minimal techno track with a sort of retro Detroit feel perhaps?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Tnx 11U [2023]
trackinfo.about:
"Tnx 11U" was born from an experiment utilising the powerful performance feature of the Novation Supernova II synth.
This enables the synth to layer up to eight individual programs, each program can use up to three oscillators and independent FX etc.
I created a synth pad and then duplicated it and detuned the pitches of each program, I then had a monster 12 oscillator pad with huge palette of FX which created the rather large swelling soundscape that dominates the track. The further addition of complex programmed drum parts and mutation of each drum element created a very experimental IDM track.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: 2nd Synergy [2017]
trackinfo.about: Originally started in 2017 this piece was left unfinished until Autumn 2023. Not a lot of additional work was needed, just some drum edits and a better mix and FX. I like its atmospheric yet minimalistic shifting sequences and retro feel.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Under Watchful Eyes [2018]
trackinfo.about: This track was created with my travelling mobile set up and was written in Arizona in late 2018 just using MacBook, Ableton and soft synths and a keyboard controller for performing keys etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Sdnfnk [2019]
trackinfo.about: One of the only tracks which I would consider to be more within the "House Music" genre of this collection. From my memory the bones of this track were completed within an evening in late summer of 2021.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Summertime Ends [2017]
trackinfo.about:
An experiment with electro-acoustic jazz instruments, Upright Bass and Rhodes piano and a percussive loop. A Lot of jazz music is often just comprising of a trio of musicians, drummer, bass and keys or wind instrument etc.
I wanted to see if I could created something along the lines of acoustic jazz but within the digital realm, this is not the first time Ive created similar works.
I've always been fascinated by the brilliance of Coltrane's "Love Supreme" and its bass with its distinctive simplicity, this was a starting point to see if I could create a simple bass hook that I could play something more free/improvised over.
I love the Rhodes and it always inspires. There is however one additional instrument; a synth lead improv in the middle and some editing and manipulation of the drum section to try and keep the percussive elements interesting.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol 6, released October 26, 2023

trackinfo.title: Urnctrl [2001]
trackinfo.about:
Early electro flavoured track were I used the vocoder of the Supernova II.
The lyrical elements are embarrassingly simple but its a fun track that mixes light and dark synth tones, I guess my Kraftwerk/John Carpenter influences come through a little?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Telson [2015]
trackinfo.about: An early experiment with my Korg MS20 Mini & Sq1 Sequencer led to the raw and intense synth bass riff. The addition of the live drum sample that just seemed to sit so well along with a few other MophoX4 Synth parts added a bit more atmosphere. I kinda intended to return to it but never did, I still like its raw feel today.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Interstate [2004]
trackinfo.about: Clearly a Detroit/Chicago Techno/House influenced track. One that was supposed to be part of a 12" with a label that kept delaying the release. Eventually the label folded. So here it is!
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Sketches Of Night [2016]
trackinfo.about: Me just playing around, improvising in a Jazz & dub style led to this, some editing of the more coherent musical structures and I pretty much finish this track in one night, hence the title :)
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Static Distortion [2003]
trackinfo.about: One of those moments when you are working on something downtempo and then the bassline happened and everything changed. A sort of unique take on breakbeat/jungle. Always loved the energy of this one.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Sunlit Flowers [2005]
trackinfo.about:
the very light and kinda fluffy piano riff and key change came out of nowhere almost,
just the right amount of inspiration. I added the drum loop as a guide. The other synth parts etc came together in one day basically.
I meant to return to the drums as they are a bit loopy but I think the melodies carry the track. A few attempts to do more with the drums didn't seem to work. I left the track for years and then a catastrophic crash meant I lost the project. This is the only mix I have.
Listening back now I'd mix and arrange it differently but still glad to have this mix!
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Acsending Angels [2001]
trackinfo.about: Cannot really remember too much about the production of this track. One that sort of came together in a day.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Roboutique [2006]
trackinfo.about: A simple but catchy Electro  track.Me  just having fun!
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: I Stole That Soul [2000]
trackinfo.about: This track came about from a competition in a music magazine, where they gave a CD with a selection of samples from the Salsoul label. Used just the one famous disco loop and built the track with my Supernova II which I did not have very long. I submitted to the comp but didn't win. However at a busy Dublin club night I gave the DJ who I barely knew a CDR, the club was hoping and he mixed it into his set to my surprise! I was super happy that the dance floor stayed full while my track played.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: D.H.A.C. [1999]
trackinfo.about: Any early Techno/trance track, just using my Yamaha CS1X, my Emu ESI400 sampler to the best of my knowledge.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.about: An electro track that I always felt had a lot more promise, found it hard to return to and then my studio changed. This is the only mix I have. Still really like the structure even though the drums are pretty basic.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Overload [2000]
trackinfo.about:
An early Drum & bass/Jungle track using the MC303 for some drums,
a well known jungle/break and the Supernova II for synth parts
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Station 2 Station [2002]
trackinfo.about: A sort of slow soulful Electro track, kinda reminded me of travelling or going on journey by train for some reason.

trackinfo.title: Mobile fony [2000]
trackinfo.about: An early track house/tech track created while getting to grips with the Supernova II.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Vanishing Points [2008]
trackinfo.about: A mix of Dub Techno and Ambient with some hypnotic melodic parts later. Me trying to add something different to a genre that is often very regimental.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Five, released November 18, 2021

trackinfo.title: Impactor [2003]
trackinfo.about:
Impactor initially started out as an Ambient track, I had the main big bass synth pad and the lead that followed and played around with it in various ways, nothing appeared to really work as I felt I had a fairly strong hook/riff going on with a solid identity.
I played around with some drums as I felt a Techno Direction may work. I was a big fan of Carl Craig's 69 works etc and his sort of proto-jungle techno, I decided to look for some breakbeats, from what I can remember the first one I came across I knew as soon as I heard it that was the one! As soon as I dropped it in, the rest of the track just came together with ease.
Additional drums were programmed and a tribal loop sat well along with the additional synth stabs that give a sense of urgency and that undercurrent sustained phased drone added further suspense.
Unfortunately I could never find the original audio stems/samples as this track was created pre Ableton, and it was a mixture of midi Sysex sending back to my Supernova synth, midi triggered via Logic, samples saved on Iomega Zip drives all mixed live and recorded directly through an analogue desk to CD recorder.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Dubech [2004]
trackinfo.about: This is a simple enough Dub Techno track which came about from just an experiment is playing some dub style bass lines and keys. This later became the foundation of a Remix later on.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Breathe [2002]
trackinfo.about: Most of the synth sounds come from my Supernova II, from a sort of an experimental ambient session. For some reason I could hear a drum break in my head. I left the track for a while and one day while listening a recent jazz influenced CD I purchased this section of drum was played along for one bar, so I sampled it and chopped it up a bit and it worked along with additional drum hits I programmed. The acoustic guitar part was kindly played by my friend Neil, I kinda hummed the simple phrase and he got it exactly.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Moodswings [2001]
trackinfo.about:
Generally Im not one for sampling at all. With Moodswings the baseline and jazzy percussion appeared in a piece of music isolated for a moment, the bass is just a turnaround part of the track, it only appears once for the two seconds or so, it seemed like a really nice loop that I had never heard being used before and decided to play with it.
At the breakdown part I used one of the EMU ESI's powerful filters to completely cut out the bass line and just leave the percussion part audible.
The sax is my Korg Prophecy, strings and most other instruments are the Supernova II. Piano part is the Yamaha CS1X.
This is the only recording of this track that I have.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: F**k Off Drummer [2001]
trackinfo.about: As the title suggests this is me have fun with the Funky Drummer drum loop.All done pretty much with my EMU ESI4000 sampler, no wave form editing, serious number crunching to edit the loop, the Juno bass was a multisample from a CD rom library that I played on my midi keyboard, some additional drums com from my MC303.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Fused With Blues [2001]
trackinfo.about: A slow mo style electro track that to me came out with a certain bluesy feel, to me anyhow, the simple bass hook and the the sort of predictable but Detroit style pad and then the lead with a soulful sort of pitch bent vibe.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Atmosphere 310410 Faxology Demo outtake [2010]
trackinfo.about:
A short Ambient piece, which I remember was originally going to be part of the Faxology Demo. In the end it I decided not to include in the demo as it
was pushing the time allowed on CD and it felt more like an interval piece.
Unfortunately, I can no longer locate the original audio elements as I've often felt it could have been developed further, but I still like it as it is.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Pulsar [2008]
trackinfo.about: Pulsar, was originally an attempt at creating something Berlin School but turned out more Techno I guess?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Slow Drive [2000]
trackinfo.about:
This is a short idea track, a sort of a late night drive electro style.
Often felt it could have been developed further but still like its simplicity.
The piano, the strings etc give it a slight cinematic feel?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: A different Drum [2003]
trackinfo.about:
A more experimental, industrial heavy beat driven track. A sort of early
Autechre/Beaumont Hannant style with a less musical vibe.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Alien Nightlife [2001]
trackinfo.about: An early atmospheric Electro style track created with my Supernova II and CS1X synth for drums.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: Maybe The Next Time [2002]
trackinfo.about:
Written at a sort of personal crossroads in my life. An attempt to express a certain feeling with a sort of orchestrated synth sound mainly my Supernova II again. The drums are the CS1X 808 kit.
Listening back now there are somethings I would would approach or treat differently but I still like its sentiments.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

trackinfo.title: A Resonant Life {For Pete} [2013]
trackinfo.about:
This was one of two tracks that I composed with the massive
Pete Namlook "Die Welt Est Klang" tribute compilation in mind.
The track that I submitted in the end was "The Light That Burns"
Which I felt was finished and was a fitting personal tribute.
This is the original mix that I finished a little after the comp had been finalised and was never shared with anyone until now.
A resonant Life still holds a special place for me and brings me back to that sense of great loss we all felt when Pete suddenly left us.
I am happy to share this original mix with you and feel it finishes of
Vol 4 nicely.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Four, released October 28, 2021

Mick Chillage.title: Orphaned Tracks Vol One
Mick Chillage.about:
Orphaned tracks Vol 1 is part of a series of unreleased tracks, lost & found tracks, unfinished ideas etc, that cover a spectrum of electronic music genres.
Listening back now I would have a arranged and mixed some of these differently but in many cases I do not have the original kit or audio parts to return to them.
Most of the tracks within the series were recorded sometime after 1998.
I expanded my studio beyond the Roland MC303 which I used extensively between 1996 to 1998. The music contained have been written/recorded between 1998 right up to recent years, so expect quite a difference in both musicality & production values.
I have mastered the tracks to garner a coherent balance where possible.
Some pieces I found only have one recording, or a rough mix draft were I planned to go back and work further but never did & then eventually the equipment I used to make the original had become no longer part of my set up.
Many of these tracks came about during sessions for a particular album but either didn't fit the running time restrictions or just felt a little out of place or the record label felt it did not suit the aesthetic but I still have love for many these.
Others came about from a jam with a new piece of equipment and I just hit record. Some are ideas I had but could never develop them further and got left behind.
I feel a time has come to share these lost moments, ideas, sketches that show various moments of my development as an artist which bring me to where I am today, a somewhat focused creator with more discipline and an aesthetic that I think I can now call my own.
Click on each track to see a little bit of info on each piece if interested.
I hope you enjoy these pieces that you can maybe use to make your own playlists.
Mick Chillage
Oct 2021
Mick Chillage.credits:
released September 23, 2021
Wriiten, produced, recorded & mastered by Michael Gainfrord.

trackinfo.title: Opening [2004]
trackinfo.about: One of the first tracks I completed using Ableton software after using Logic midi only for many years. My new found freedom of easily manipulating grooves is quite evidant on this track. Synth sounds are mainly my Novation Supernova II.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Marvels Of Space [2002]
trackinfo.about: A short Ambient piece that I've always liked, recorded using Logic and my Supernova II a tiny audible pop is present in this original recording from 2002.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Oracle [2001]
trackinfo.about: I had my Supernova II only a few weeks when I recorded this. Electro drums come from the Yamaha CS1X.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Menace [2002]
trackinfo.about: My attempt at making a deep pounding Techno track. The drums where from an EMU hip hop hit pack, but liked the thumping heavy vibe, further processing through my mixer and the Supernova providing synth duties, pre DAW days mixed down live and recoded to CD directly.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Over Dubbed [2001]
trackinfo.about: An experiment in creating dub digitally, no samples other than the groove loop along with a programmed drum part. various synths and FX.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Night Walking [2013]
trackinfo.about: A jazz influenced track, the bass comprises of a multi sampled upright bass that I played along with various improv keys. Kinda reminded me of late night walking through a rainy city.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Chaos & Beauty [2002]
trackinfo.about: The famous "Amen" loop was added to an initial Ambient track that I had started using just the Supernova II. I had a chopped up break from an earlier session saved in mu Emu ESI400 this was done with no visual waveform just number crunching to chop it up. Was very happy with this, although its not traditional Jungle/drum and bass with a more Berlin School style bass etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Pause For Thought [2017]
trackinfo.about: This came about with the inspiration of some field recordings I took in Arizona in 2017, the guitar part was played by using a multisample guitar instrument in Ableton. I tried to capture a sleepy desert day. A sort of shoe gaze ambient piece.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Evening Sun [2014]
trackinfo.about: I've always had a passion for Deep House music, from the likes of Wamdue Project, Timewritter, Susumo Yakota etc. this is one of many Ive done over the years. I just never found a suitable project for it to fit with. The sax stab riff is the Korg Prophecy, various other synths and soft drum hits etc are used on this.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Acid Test [2015]
trackinfo.about: I had recently acquired a Deeper MS-404 which is known for its capability to emulate the TB303 very well. Im not super obsessed with the 303 sound but back in the late 80's I was hooked on it and the Acid House music of that period was hugely responsible for my passion with electronic music. Anyway this is the first time I used the MS, Tried to create a very stripped down Chicago jacking sound of the mid to late 80's.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Go Lucky [2014]
trackinfo.about:
From what I can remember this was an early track using the Korg MS20 mini and the SQ1 sequencer along with some keys on the poly Mophox4.
Its a playful melodic track, rare for me I guess ;)
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.about: A very early experimental IDM style ambient piece. Unfortunately I only had the one recording of this. sequenced on Logic and recorded directly to my old CD recorder. Some live FX through the mixer etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Atmosphreq [2003]
trackinfo.about: A short doodle with my Supernova II, never got a chance to expand on it but I like it as it is I guess?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: E.T.A. [2000]
trackinfo.about: This track was created using my Emu ESI Turbo sampler, utilising the Emu multisample CD rom libraries. The Juno bass and pads came from these all were played on my keyboard. The drums are the Yamaha CS1X 808 kit from the best of my memory.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Close [2006]
trackinfo.about: A friend asked me to create a little piece of music to go with his flash video for his video production company logo, only nine seconds, a challenge for me. Don't think he used it in the end.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol One, released September 23, 2021

trackinfo.title: Initiate Sequence Live take [2015]
trackinfo.about:
This was on of the first tracks I create using the Korg SQ1 sequencer triggering the MS20 Mini, I also used the MophoX4 for poly pads and routed some FX. It was a live jam that I Intended to return and fine tune, but somewhere in the process I lost the recording of the MS20 sequence.
This track has a somewhat Berlin School/70's Space music sound.
This recording may have a little bit too much overdrive in places for some tastes. Which is an artefact of the MS20's filters and my somewhat enthusiastic approach to the control knobs at the time of the life performance :)
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Your Space Or Mine [2005]
trackinfo.about:
Around this time I was soaking up a lot of Dub influenced Techno again, enjoying artists like Yagya, Rod Model etc, This was one of my attempts at a genre that also became extremely formulaic & easily replicated.
I still like this track very much, today I'd probably mix it a little differently.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Eternal Light [2001]
trackinfo.about: A sort of slower homage to much of the earlier, techno, trance of the early 90's particularly some the tracks that were emerging from Germany, like Harthouse, Fax, etc. I mainly used the Supernova II on this track.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Electromotive Force [2003]
trackinfo.about:
I guess this was me trying to create something in the style of David Morley/Peter Benisch etc, more on a subconscious level.
A mix of slow 808 Electro patterns, big overdriven 808 bass hits and Ambient pads flowing along with a slightly gliding arpeggio and a melodic phrase with chime like synth sounds.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Here Comes The Sun [2006]
trackinfo.about: An uplifting House influenced track, created in early Summer of 2006, a deep played baseline and pads and various hooks melodies and poly drum programming.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Revolutions [2002]
trackinfo.about: A striped back Detroit Techno flavoured track, sort of a dark hypnotic vibe and solid programmed 909 drums, the synth riff is the midi file of the drum part assigned to a nice synth sound, pads and hooks arrive and a deep stabbing baseline. It builds in the usual way, filter sweeps and drum break downs etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Mopho & Mini [2015]
trackinfo.about:
I purchased the Mophox4 and Korg MS20 mini on the same day.
My intention was to purchase the Mopho poly but the MS20 was in the corner of the shop, I played around with it for a few minutes and I was blown away by its instant sonic madness I was hearing so easilyfrom the dedicated knobs alone, not even patching. Being fully aware of this legendary synth I decided to bring it home on the same day.
Within a few days of setting up both in my studio, this track emerged. The MS20 producing the most unique sax like tone and playing with its dual filter the sound you hear at the start is just one patch no multi tracking and improvisation, some rumbling of the filters is present at times!
The pad and the synth sequence is the mophoX4 & some basic live drum loops and layered filtered drums for some sonic interest.
Recorded in a day I knew I had made the right choice with these two powerful analogue synths.
This is however the only recording I have of "Mopho & Mini"
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Century City [1999]
trackinfo.about:
Century City is inspired by the Fox Plaza building in LA, famously known for its appearance in the Die hard movie as the Nakatomi HQ.
I first visited California in 1996 my first time on a plane out of Ireland, so a huge trip for me, my friend took me there to a rather cheesy night club that was running in the basement of the building but was great to be in such a well known building. A few more times in the late 90's I travelled back to LA and often saw the building in the distance as we drove around the sprawling city.
So after a visit in late 99' I returned to rainy old Dublin and wrote this short piece and the title just jumped out at me as we were also rapidly approaching the end of the 20th century and heading into a new millennium and I felt the track has a certain futuristic feel.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Sightings [2002]
trackinfo.about:
Another one of my rare Drum & Bass or Jungle inspired tracks.
This one doesn't follow the traditional boomy half speed bass that
was the norm within the genre, a rolling sped up funky drummer break and some additional heavily overdriving groove riding under a spacey otherworldly pad and bleeping synth line with a bass sequence keep the bottom end together.
Flanging on the drums adds an interesting break in the middle.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Bleep [2001]
trackinfo.about:
Named after and brilliant underground club night ran by the guys behind Decal Alan & Dennis. Both myself and Paul Chillage got many DJing slots here because of our well known and respected radio show.
I wrote this track after one of the nights and hence the name "Bleep" Its a simple drone and layered groove track with little melodic flourishes and deep bass but brings me back to the kind of music often played at the nights back then.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Frequently [2004]
trackinfo.about: A sort of homage to the bleep and raw Techno of the early 90's dare say LFO, Testone etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Reprised [2000]
trackinfo.about: An early downtempo style track using my newly acquired Novation Supernova II & my Emu ESI4000 sampler for drum loops etc.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Observing Birds [2017]
trackinfo.about:
After another trip to California & Arizona in October of 2017 I went armed with my Zoom portable recorder I captured some early morning birdsong in Tucson. Upon returning to Dublin in early November and being full of inspiration from another incredible trip, this is one of the many tracks that came about from my field recordings.
There's a sense of melancholy in the piano keys and lead sounds, it rides along a lowkey pitched 808 drum pattern, some additional digital edits to the piano section gives it a slightly experimental touch towards the end.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Three, released October 7, 2021

trackinfo.title: Homeless [2003]
trackinfo.about:
This piece came about after a night out in Dublin city, it was a cold night & was struck by the amount of homeless people I saw settling down to try and sleep for the night in the busy capital.
The following day I was playing about with the equipment with no real intention of creating anything and I played the opening piano riff and then the sad synth lead and it struck a chord with me. somehow the rest of the track just happened super quick, on auto pilot and what you hear now was the result of perhaps two hours work.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Breaking Dawn [2001]
trackinfo.about: Playing around with my Supernova I created around that somehow felt like early morning bird song, I continued with beats and pads and bass and that huge kick drum!
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Ambient Interval [2005]
trackinfo.about: Just a short Ambient texture that I never felt a need to develop further.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Refocus [2001]
trackinfo.about:
About 2001 myself and Paul Chillage were at the height of our somewhat cult radio show the Chillage Idiots, we often had guests from around the globe artist, label bosses etc. Pete Namlook, Jimi Tenor, Lackluster etc featured. So in 2001 we done a special with Focus records boss Claire and some of the artists Tim Koch and Cim also joined in for phone chat.
Through that conversation Claire was interested in hearing some of my material, she particularly like this untitled Electro track which I re titled "Refocus" which was the new name of her label.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Proximity Alert [2002]
trackinfo.about: A sort of an attempt at Sci Fi Ambient Electro.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Supernova [2000]
trackinfo.about: This is the very first track I created on my Novation Supernova II which I purchased in 2000. The drum parts are from the Yamaha CS1X.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: What Surrounds Us [2008]
trackinfo.about: A short Ambient piece which I've always like its atmosphere and shifting chords.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: 160 Smooth [2011]
trackinfo.about: Initially this was a piece that start with the playful key riff. It was played at 80 Bpm. I added a slowed down hip hop style groove and then I just started adding double speed grooves and chopping them up, it was never my initial intention to create Drill & Bass style track, inspiration took over!
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Coast Cruise [2014]
trackinfo.about: A single two chord moment using cinematic style texture pad lead me to more of jazz route, the upright bass the leads etc, it kinda placed me in a classic open top car driving along the south of France coastline in the 60's.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Jose's Dream [2013]
trackinfo.about: A dreamy house type track with polyrhythms and bouncy bass and synth hooks, to me it has a Latin feel at times, maybe I'm wrong?
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Loosing Keys [2015]
trackinfo.about:
A completely random House music moment from me.
The basic organ hook, my funky bassline and poly grooves lead me to a surprising twisting improvised lead.
The lead happened in one take and I was glad that I was recording at the time. The track has a rawness to it that I like.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: De Ja View [2002]
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

trackinfo.title: Always The Same Dream [2016]
trackinfo.about: This track came about from experimenting with a multisample guitar instrument, trying to do my version of shoegaze, as the chords progressed I added the little bit of playfulness to it, it felt kinda like a 70's instrumental piece so I added a virtual CR78 drum programmed part, towards the end some real analogue synths for a slight epic attempt at 70's synth music. I'm particularly found of this track that conjures different vast landscapes and times a possible future memories.
trackinfo.credits: from Orphaned Tracks Vol Two, released September 30, 2021

Mick Chillage.title: Paths
Mick Chillage.about:
Mick Chillage returns to Databloem with Paths double CD
Want to buy the double CD?
Go to:
databloem.com/home/1106-mick-chillage-paths.html
Mick Chillage returns to Databloem with a varied double album of the finest Ambient Explorations & Grooves .CD 1 continues where his previous Databloem album "Distant Light" left off. Mixing up his influences effortlessly, Mick sees his production techniques like a reflection of life choices, sudden unexpected changes in path result in new often unimagined sonic adventures.
Alien drones and mechanical found sounds can mutate into minimalist Techno workouts, wild analogue experimentation can be calmed with orchestral touches and finely tuned sinewave melodies. Often utilising just one patch to create a rich and evolving musical narrative.
Disc Two is as diverse as the title suggests and lets Mick explore his Ambient expanse with no compromise. Full of majesty and loss in equal measure Mick here explores the humanity/spirituality often lost in electronic music composition and is possibly best listened to in personal headspaces.

Mick Chillage.title: Pixels
Mick Chillage.about:
"Pixels" is the first "Long Form" ambient experimental album from Mick Chillage which was inspired by the masters of the "Long Form" track like Pete Namlook, William Basinski, Atom Heart, Tetsu Inoue and Brian Eno.
"Pixels" is dedicated to modern humans who spend an average of 60% of our day starring at a computer screen.
"Pixels" was released on limited CD through Anodize recordings.
CD's are now sold out!!
anodizesound.bandcamp.com/album/pixels-june

Mick Chillage.title: Pixels II
Mick Chillage.about:
Limited CD released on Anodize
This what the label says.
Quietly arresting second chapter in the Pixels series by Mick Chillage. Like the subtlest works by Eno, this one unfolds slowly as its myriad sounds creep up on you.
Mick Chillage returns to the Anodize fold with volume two in his Pixels series of longform neuro-ambient works. Pixels II works the same phantasmic mojo as its predecessor, trading in irruptive gestures that shiver and undulate across an ever-shifting aural environment. Over its near hour-length lifespan, it's become evident that Mr. Chillage has truly earned his stripes as one of ambient music's best contemporary prognosticators, recalling not only classic FAX sides of the 90s era, but pointing the way towards all kinds of bright, impressionistic futures.
Mr. Chillage has already built quite the rep for himself, releasing music across a slew of labels (Fax, Psychonavigation, etc.) and in many different styles. For Anodize, last year's electro-themed release under his The Shape alias was one of his more provocative recordings, and with the Pixels series, he continues reworking a minimalist ambient canvas thanks to a seemingly endless supply of distinctive aural squibs.
CD's available here:
anodizesound.bandcamp.com/album/pixels-ii

Mick Chillage.title: Pixels III
Mick Chillage.about:
Anodize is very pleased to present the final captivating volume in Mick Chillage's stellar "Pixels" series.
In completing this trilogy, it's obvious upon listening to this latest longform work that Mr. Chillage can hold his own as one of the contemporary masters of modern ambient electronica. Across a now dizzying catalog of releases, both solo & in collaboration with many like-minded colleagues, Mick has demonstrated an almost uncanny way with knob, slider, potentiometer, sequencer, trackpad, and mouse. But the device through which he works his alchemy is irrelevant; it's always the talent behind the tool, and Mick's cantilevered soundscapes never fail to engage the imagination.
"Pixels III" is no exception. From twilight reverie to predawn ecstasy, shadow to substance, the good Mr. Chillage has devised an dense world of sound that is as colorfully navigable as those augured by such noted antecedents as Mssrs. Eno, Namlook, Mixmaster Morris and a small gaggle of others. Fine company to keep indeed, but no second, moment, or texture goes wasted; this is a broad artistic statement to not only treasure but to revisit time and again.

Mick Chillage.title: Points Of Gradation
Mick Chillage.about:
"Points Of Gradation" was originally released on Before & After Silence Recordings in Feb 2025
In late 2022 I acquired my sisters old acoustic guitar and set about with the intention to firstly experiment with it for some sonic textures that may sit with certain projects. Over sometime I began to develop some themes or compositions within my limited playing ability, however I was quite pleased with the emotions that they appeared to convey.
During this period, naturally I had accumulated various synth based ambient works that covered various themes and moods and I also played some acoustic moments with certain pieces.
Cut to summer of 2023 I now had what felt like the foundation for a new album that included a mix of pure synth based ambient and some with the acoustic guitar taking centre stage & a mix of both approaches.
I knew this was going to be a bit of leap for me releasing this to the world as I'm mainly known for purely electronic based music with occasional filed recordings and electroacoustic & found sounds.
However, from an artists point of view its always being important for me to grow in someway, take risks, jump genres etc so I decided to complete this collection of pieces and present a new album! The last part of the creative process was creating a title... more

Mick Chillage.title: Pulsations
Mick Chillage.about:
Pulsations was born from some experimentations with the Moog Grandmother in early October by just playing around creating various drones, using different oscillator combinations, filtering, envelopes and subtle modulations.
Each one had the same tuning and was just played at different keys.
From there other polyphonic synths were used to create deeper or more mysterious atmospheres and an emotional sense, switching from light to dark.
A lot of manipulation of the source material and use of FX and careful mixing and arranging resulted in the 50 minute piece, which I hope gives a sense of otherworldly escapism while listening.
March 2025 "Pulsations" got a new extended mix & a 24Bit remaster.

Mick Chillage.title: Reverie
Mick Chillage.about:
Mick Chillage is back on ...txt, his spiritual home. Mick's new album counts in six tracks of deep emotive ambience that flickers between minimalistic piano compositions, drones and lush ambient textures.
"Reverie" is a state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts...a daydream.
A limited CD glass master version was available from the txt store but now is sold out. A limited amount of CD's will be available shortly from this bandcamp page.
This album is sequenced for a continuos listening experience.

Mick Chillage.title: Rewired Volume 2 [Remixes By Mick Chillage]
Mick Chillage.about:
Over the last few years I have been fortunate to be asked to do many remixes for various labels, artists, and friends, many of which saw mainly digital releases and a few which made it onto CD and some of which unfortunately never ended up being released.
In some cases where I created an ambient remix of a techno track, I found these often got overlooked somewhat, a problem due to the fact that they ended up in the techno or house sections of Juno or Beatport etc.. I guess my thinking outside of the box in these very much genre specific days was a poor creative decision on my part ?
But my true feelings on the art of remix is that the remix should really bring something new to the original track, rather than purely just adding a new rhythm section or stuttering and juggling and filtering the musical elements of the original, so this is what I tried to achieve with these. From a creative aspect I am still extremely happy with these remixes despite their lack of critical or commercial success.
Now in 2013 I have over 30 remixes on my hard drive and feel that it would be a great time to bring most of these together in two collections.
Volume two will feature the more upbeat moments which venture from Electro, Techno, House, IDM etc.. Both volumes will feature some previously unreleased remix exclusives.
Of course none of this would have been possible without the assistance of all the great artists and labels
who firstly asked me to remix them and now have given me the freedom to finally release all these remixes myself... So a big thank you to all involved.

Mick Chillage.title: Rise
Mick Chillage.about:
"Rise" is a collection of three improvisational piano based pieces that were first composed in late 2023 & early 2024.
The title track "Rise" was inspired by an early morning walk on a super crisp December morning. As I left my house and looked across the park the sun was rising and a mist was carpeting the grass as the sun thawed frost that had fallen over night.
I took a photo as there was something magical about the stillness in the air & how the sun cast shadows of the leafless winter trees across the frosted green.
Shortly after my walk I decided to load up my kit and played around with an improvised passage that became the foundation for "Rise"
I returned to the piece in the New Year to arrange further and add additional musical parts and textures & from this I was inspired some more & "Reassurance" came about as I took a break from the arranging of "Rise" this new piece seemed to fit well with the themes that had developed although compositionally they both felt very distinct.
Feb 2024 I was out and about with my Zoom recorder in a local forest and captured some recordings, it also was a very sunny day and beams of light stretched across the forest. I got home and listened to the field recordings and immediately began to play some piano keys over the recordings along with some dramatic ambient tones & strings.
Naturally this became "Forest Light" I now had what I felt like was a new piano based ambient album.
I hope you enjoy my latest release of Piano based ambient works.
Mick Chillage
March 2025

Mick Chillage.title: Saudade
Mick Chillage.label: Carpe Sonum Records
Mick Chillage.about: Saudade is defined as "the recollection of feelings, experiences, places or events that once brought excitement, pleasure, well-being, which now triggers the senses and makes one live again." While Mick Chillage has been creating some of today's most priceless upbeat but laid-back electronic music, he brings home the 'Chill' in his moniker with a deep and heavily submersive ambient opus that ventures fathoms away from his previous masterpiece "FAXology." With Saudade, he shares deep reflections that are as divine as they are unforgettable.

Mick Chillage.title: Senescence
Mick Chillage.about:
"Senescence" was born from a recent beautiful autumn day.
This year the changing colour of the leaves has been a little slower than usual, perhaps due to a milder September & October. As I walked in my local park a week ago I was surprised by a lot of wild flowers still blooming yet a lonely fallen leaf was on the narrow pathway, I took a picture, the striking colours against the aged and broken path inspired me.
Later that day I was compelled to play some keys, I improvised for about five minutes or so using the Native instruments "Maverick" Piano instrument.
I added some subtle delays and FX and layered a Rhodes at an octave higher to add a little more tonal depth. Over the next few hours I added various analogue synth sounds some musical & others that ended up sounding like leaves spinning as they fall to the ground and others appeared to almost emulate bird song.
Further improvised piano were added as the piece progressed, adding bass tones and higher twinkling keys. A mix of Moog, Prophet & MS20 sounds in various ways finished off the track.
I hope what you hear in this piece can evoke a sense of calm & wonder and emotions that the autumn months can bring.
Mick Chillage October 2020.
Senescence was given a new extended mix & 24Bit master in March 2025

Mick Chillage.title: Skua Atlantic: Atlantic Fusion
Mick Chillage.about:
Skua Atlantic are Icelandic based rni Grtar AKA Futuregrapher and Irish based Michael Gainford AKA Mick Chillage.
The project came about after the two producers connected through social media, realizing they both had very similar influences, from early Acid House to Detroit Techno and Electro to Ambient music and IDM.
Initially, they first worked together in the form of a remix as Futuregrapher created a remix for Mick's house influenced "Soul Ideals" EP way back in 2012.
Finally, in 2015 the two started to share tracks and ideas over the internet and an album started to develop which encompassed a myriad of genres and influences moods and emotions that mutate the borders of dancefloor techno and home listening electronica.
Written, mixed and produced by Mick Chillage and rni Grtar in Iceland and Ireland 2015.
rni
Thanks to friends, family, Mller, Extreme Chill.

Thanks to Dennis, Paul Chillage for continued support and encouragement and all those who support my music.

Mick Chillage.title: Sky Gazing
Mick Chillage.about:
All proceeds for this album got to Mcmillan Cancer support
Purchase the album from
touched.bandcamp.com/album/sky-gazing
I am proud to announce my mini album for Touched music.
Touched music, where Some of the planet's greatest Electronic, Ambient & Modern Classical musicians come together for an amazing cause, all proceeds to Macmillan Cancer Support.
What Touched music say about "Sky Gazing"
If the last twelve months have left you feeling a bit confused with all the political madness both sides of the pond, theres one things thats necessary in order to help you through it all. Thats right, the steady and constant truth that is Touched Music.
Its not all doom & gloom, oh no. This year saw the label hit 50,000 raised for Macmillan Cancer Support and to help us continue forth the latest and final release of 2016 comes from Dublins very own Mick Chillage.
Sky Gazing is worthy of repeat audition, doing so will allow you to scrape away at the upper layer of staple chill, ambient & downtempo beats, revealing new beauty which appears each time round.
The EP opens with a feeling truly like Ageispolis meets Cocteau Twins and almost fooling you into thinking this is going to be a simple affair. What follows is remarkable work, including a thirteen-minute rendition you could really watch the
clouds to, rolling undertones paired with moody, low acid-squelches, lovely hi-hats, and even a funky & trippy penultimate piece in the form of Fusion Intrusion.
The final track really feels final and demonstrates how fantastically produced the whole thing is. All the tracks manage to emulate each other but no two truly sound the same, establishing a real flow that will draw you in and put this one straight onto repeat."
