Mick Chillage.title: Skywave Transmissions
Mick Chillage.about:
The title track "Skywave Transmissions" was conceived in spring of 2023.
The initial sketch had sat on my hard drive through the rest of the year due to my ongoing concussion symptoms.
At the beginning of 2024 I decided to return to the track and proceeded with a live digital mix and then with some editing of the track arrived at the thirty minute plus final version.
I guess this fits in within a certain meditative ambient feel but has certain elements that fit with the concept of the earths natural magnetic field and how science and modern technology has developed methods to use these phenomena as a means of driving communication.
Skywave refers to the electromagnetic wave reflected or refracted from the ionosphere and propagated in the form of a guided wave between the ionosphere and the Earth's surface. Since the skywave can propagate over large distances, it has been widely used in long-distance communication.
Upon returning to the track I felt that the piece needed a companion with a slightly darker feel. I set to work on my Moog Grandmother and created various shifting modulated drones with a certain ominous feel & some sequences that could drift in and out that suggest various radio waves bouncing back and fourth through our atmosphere, this track became HF Radiation.
I hope you enjoy my latest digital long-form album dedicated to our much reliant communication systems & the brilliant minds that created this technology.
Mick Chillage
March 2024

Mick Chillage.title: So Far From Home
Mick Chillage.about:
Its been a while since I've created anything that perhaps could
fit into an often saturated genre "Space Ambient"
Late one night in May of 2020 I created a patch on the Moog Grandmother which I played some improvised passages, one particular section kinda resonated with me, sounding like a musical alert from some lunar craft so I looped that section.
I turned to the MS20 and turned its dials to find a deep bass drone and then added various patching and modulation settings to change the tone in various ways over time. Another lengthy improvisation was captured with the MS2O that worked in a deep and mysterious way to me, it was late so I saved my session and went to bed.
The next day, while in work various parts were floating through my head and I had some mental ideas where to go next. I went through a folder of recorded sounds from various films that I had been building up. I took some machine like sounds which I pitched and manipulated in various ways to suit the sonic back drop I already had. I then added some improvised voice like pads from the Prophet Rev 2 which I had edited to suit the building structure, some more Moog, some more MS20 and more Rev2 by that night I had a total of 23 individual elements that I could play around with and all seemed to work well together.
The following day I mixed and arranged pretty much what you hear now in the final mix.
I hope this track manages to keep your attention as it passes through various sections which hopefully conjures up eerie atmospheres and emotions.
I also avoided the temptation to use blatantly obvious sound bites from the movies which was very popular in the early to mid 90's and often used as a cheap trick to give a track a certain kudos or make appear deeper than the music actually is.
To me "So far From Home" sounds like a lonely journey through some of the deepest yet unexplored galaxies with only the sounds of the machines onboard to keep you company.
Only you the listener can decide where this piece of music takes you for almost 60 minutes.

Mick Chillage.title: So Far From Home
Mick Chillage.about:
CD Originally released on Before & After Silence Recordings.
In July of 2020 I released a digital only version of So Far From Home it was a return to a Space Music style which Im probably best known for with my release FAXology
The track was a synergy of both Analogue & Digital synths, some found sounds & sound bites that I had collected over time, I initially built a foundation of various hums/drones manipulated machine-like sounds etc and then added more musical themes that gave a sense of being transported through deep space with only the mechanical & electronic sounds of the hi tech craft to keep you company.
I felt it was important to convey some varying emotional moods; as on this journey you encounter various majestic phenomena with a sense of wonder with moments of loneliness and uncertainty as you venture further out into the vastness of uncharted space.
Three distinct movements morph & shift during its fifty five minute duration.
So Far From Home was quite a popular digital release and I had some requests about a CD release at some point. I returned to the track in early jan of 2022 and after composing the accompanying track Dreams Of Our Blue Planet'' in Dec of 2021, Which I felt like it belonged within the same sonic universe.
For the CD release I went back and reworked the mix, giving some sounds more prominence and expanding the stereo mIx, additional automated panning on certain sounds along with some subtle tweaks to the arrangement and FX enhancement, which introduces some unheard tones from the original synth experimentation sessions.
I am now delighted to present this new CD Mix version of So Far From Home along with a brand new track Dreams Of Our Blue Planet which clocks in at just over twenty minutes with an emotive and deeply atmospheric aesthetic.
Mick Chillage Feb 2022

Mick Chillage.title: Temporal Cities
Mick Chillage.about:
Temporal Cities was written & recorded in late Autumn of 2022.
Initially inspired by a rather wild and experimental patch that I had created on my MS20 mini that is prominent within the first twelve minutes of the title track.
It's rather angular and morphing tones and shards of noise reminded me of architecture that can be often brutal & sleek, other synths merge that create a sense of shifting shapes and structure, almost like a cities passing skyline as you cruise on a nearby freeway and observe the decaying and newly built structures.
As the track progresses there is a a rather significant mood and tonal change, a lighter more melodic feel with a minimalistic slomo bass heavy groove but with elements of the first part are echoed deep within the mix and return again in full to close the track.
As my ideas came together I decided that I wanted to create something that merged Ambience and rhythmic structures. I worked solidly on the three main tracks over the space of a week or so.
Overall I feel there's a connected theme, although each piece has its own identity. I've also included an Alt version of "Hypnotides" along with an Ambient mix of "Oblique Horizons" which gives this album a total running time of approximately ninety five minutes of music.

Mick Chillage.title: The Function Of Life
Mick Chillage.about:
"The Function Of Life" was written & recorded in early summer of 2020. It was never my soul intention to create a more "space like" ambient body of work. The three rather longish pieces were formed within about two weeks and seemed to have a relationship or connection in some way.
I became conscious of their somewhat ethereal or other worldly trajectory but was also mindful to try to avoid being heavy handed with over used "Space Ambient" cliche's, a challenge indeed!
I tried to focus on the relationship of the sonic canvas and the movement of musical ideas that have a certain compositional value rather than just a strong sonic aesthetic or technical complexity that may not warrant multiple listens.
I hope i have succeeded in creating something that is both pure sonic escapism yet hasn't forgot to touch the various emotional sides of the listener.
The album was released through Fantasy Enhancing records in early autumn of 2020. It seemed to please fans of my FAXology album and other Fax artists and in some ways I do see it as perhaps a sequel to my debut on the influential label.
Mick Chillage Nov 2020

Mick Chillage.title: Tides Of Melancholy
Mick Chillage.about:
Tides Of Melancholy will be released just on the first anniversary of Before & After Silence Recordings in early January 2022 and it will be the sixth CD on the label. The album consists of five Ambient pieces of varying lengths, three of which were composed in 2021.
The three pieces I composed in 2021 seemed to fit within a particular emotive narrative and sonic aesthetic. I saw a connection with the piece Footsteps In Fog '' track three which I had written after the passing of Harold Budd in 2020, strangely at the time of writing the piece I felt it could possibly be part of an album at some point.
Track one Submerged Cathedrals came about rather quickly, some sonic experimentation led me to an almost human-like tonal quality that I played on the keys. This inspired me, adding more keys, piano, strings and deeper synths. The track conveys a mournful feel, like a once beautiful structure that is vividly remembered but is now lost forever in deep murky waters and its haunting sentiments sets the tone of the album.
Track Two One Sanguine Day seems to shift between a certain sombre tone and shifts with moments that shimmer with light and a sense of hope.
The title track Tides Of Melancholy feels like a soundtrack to a series of filmic snapshots from deep within a melancholic state of mind as it slowly builds and shifts to a layered tapestry of emotive tone and colour.
The closing-piece Arc Of Light was originally Written and recorded in late 2019. Its somewhat Electro-Acoustic, Neoclassical and subtle synthesised elements with the eventual emergence of a jazz influenced rhythm and bass combo lifts the track almost as if the melancholic state of mind Has subsided and finishes the theme and concept of the album
In a fitting way.
Mick Chillage

Mick Chillage.title: Time Lapsed Skies
Mick Chillage.about:
Written and recored in early Jan 2020.
"Time Lapsed Skies"Explores the relationship between various monophonic drones created with the Korg MS20 Mini and subtle improvised synth leads and polyphonic keys and pads courtesy of the Prophet Rev2.
A total of eight individual audio tracks where used along with some additional digital FX, the track was arranged on the fly and recorded.
This live arrangement and mix was then edited further to make these minimal elements work over the almost 60 minute duration.
Ideally listened to with low to medium volume in a quiet low distraction environment. Look to the skies..
Written and recorded by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin Jan 2020.
I revisited the track in 2024 and gave it a new mix.
I fixed some background noise that came from some audio bleeding of my MS20 mini with some EQ, Fixing a strange audio pop that was part of the Prophet Rev2's Envelope filter where it was a little too loud and sounded more like a distortion rather than a snapping filter attack at certain points.
Also, some mix levels, subtle arrangement changes and a new master in 24bit.
mastered by Michael Gainford
Photo: Michael Gainford.

Mick Chillage.title: Trail Of Stars
Mick Chillage.about:
Early August 2022 I drove out to a pretty remote part of the Dublin mountains to hopefully catch a glimpse of the perseid meteor shower which was at its peak. I was fortunate to see a few meteors within an hour or so of darkness and was happy to return home after experiencing this wonderful galactic phenomena.
The following day I was somewhat inspired & began to work on "Trail Of Stars" which clocks in at just over 25 minutes, its somewhat dark yet celestial and other worldly feel led me to its sort obvious but fitting title.
A few days later the star struck mood was still lingering and I felt I needed a companion of some sort to the title track, I set to work with my Prophet and Moog Grandmother along with some field recordings and created the first seven minutes of "Cosmica Sidera" In early September I returned to the track and extended it which feels like another movement that is a little more restrained yet deeper in atmosphere.

Mick Chillage.title: Transitions
Mick Chillage.about:
Transitions was originally released in 2012 as a bandcamp only
release, showcasing my various Techno & House music moods
over the years.
Sometime after its release on bandcamp a record label showed some interest in a couple of the Techno tracks. The label at the time was looking to put the tracks out as a 12" vinyl release. They requested that I removed the tracks, so i decided to withdraw the whole release rather than the few tracks.
After some delays and some issues, the label was forced to close & the tracks never got released on vinyl as planned.
So in recent times I've had some requests to make the
"Transitions" album available again. The tracks within the album are varying in genre and some date back to the early naughties so listening back now I hear things that I would definitely do differently but I still like the character & charm of these works.
The track "Alive With Wires" with its rather strong Electro flavours ended up as part of the "Waveshape Fiction" album a few years ago under my Electro alias "The Shape"
The album has now being presented in its original form but remastered by myself in March 2020.
I hope you enjoy my early take on Techno, House, Electro etc.

Mick Chillage.title: Two Days
Mick Chillage.about:
"Two Days" is now available on CD from my new formed label
Before & After Silence Recordings.
Purchase the CD here:
beforeaftersilencerecordings.bandcamp.com/releases
Towards the end of 2019 I wrote & recorded Two Days part 1
at this point it was just titled "Two Days" as I had not intended to compose a second part. My initial idea was to perhaps to do a series of long form works which would be released in the digital format, providing the inspiration continued to flow. In early 2020 I released "Two Days Pt 1" on bandcamp only and the response and support seemed very positive.
A few more long form works happened from week to week and then the Covid Pandemic lock down arrived, I found myself out of work as many others did and my long form works seemed to be a nice antidote for many who now found themselves in a new and very uncertain routine.
Many people asked if I planned to release these works on CD, which I liked the possibility of, however due to the proficient output of my work I doubted that any labels could take it on, so I decided to launch my own label to release these works. The original "Two Days" clocks in at 40 minutes so I decided that I would return to the piece and re work it and include a second part to give my fans/followers something extra if they wish to purchase the CD and also to utilise the space on the format.Towards the end of 2019 I wrote & recorded Two Days part 1 at this point it was just titled "Two Days" as I had not intended to compose a second part. My initial idea was perhaps to do a series of long form works which would be released in the digital format, providing the inspiration continued to flow. In early 2020 I released "Two Days Pt 1" on bandcamp only and the response and support seemed very positive.
A few more long form works happened from week to week and then the Covid Pandemic lock down arrived, I found myself out of work as many others did and my long form works seemed to be a nice antidote for many who now found themselves in a new and very uncertain routine.
Many people asked if I planned to release these works on CD, which I liked the possibility of, however due to the proficient output of my work I doubted that any labels could take it on, so I decided to launch my own label to release these works. The original "Two Days" clocks in at 40 minutes so I decided that I would return to the piece and re work it and include a second part to give my fans/followers something extra if they wish to purchase the CD and also to utilise the space on the format.
Recommended listening:
Ideally no distractions and Medium to low volume.

trackinfo.title: Two Days
trackinfo.about:
In the midst of chaos and uncertain times
I find myself retreating to places of comfort, these places of comfort
for me are creativity and some solitude if possible.
A brief moment to escape while lost in the process of composing or to reflect on the things I should be grateful for.
Creativity is something you can never force, A simple idea may either
end up in the thrash or blossom, I think in this case it blossomed with
a limited amount of sound sources/Instruments and time..
Only you the listener can decide on this.
I hope this piece of music can bring a little escapism from the chaos
of life as it did for the few hours while I worked on it.
Written on the 24th March 2020 at the Igloo Dublin Ireland.
Mixed and mastered on the 25th March.

Mick Chillage.title: ULF: 02
Mick Chillage.about:
End of 2025 saw the release of one of the first long form ambient works from myself in sometime in the form of "ULF: 01" Untitled Long Form. By numbering this piece I was hopeful that maybe some more works in this vein would emerge at some point.
Beginning of 2026 I sat down to experiment with just some patch creation and I had no real intention/concept of any kind in mind. The introduction layer was laid down and I began to experiment with it building on top of it with further elements, I arrived with what I felt maybe the bones of a new track as I spent some time into the early hours jamming with the ideas and letting them loop endlessly and making mental notes of how I might arrange and mix later.
The following day I awoke with the piece looping in my head and I knew that I needed to get to work on the mix and arrangement. By the end of the day the track was arranged and mixed.
This felt like a worthy sequel to ULF: 01
I hope you enjoy this second long form sonic exploration in the ULF series.
Mick Chillage Febuary 2026
Mick Chillage.credits:
released February 5, 2026
Written, produced & mastered at the Igloo Dublin 2026 by Michael Gainford
Original cover photo by Cory Mills
Art & Layout by Michael Gainford

Mick Chillage.title: ULF: 0I
Mick Chillage.about:
Its been a while since have worked on or released a long form ambient track/album. There have been some longish pieces that featured on some recent releases but none have been over forty minutes!
In early November I began to experiment with some patches I had created on my beloved Prophet Rev2, one in particular had a rather expansive sonic depth with super low bases when certain filter envelopes were tweaked.
This sound is performed as the opening passage and continues as the main foundation of the piece, played polyphonically were the low, mid & high keys are utilised which results in rumbling lows, pleasant mids and at times searing highs.
This passage seemed to inspire me on an almost instinctive level as I worked, new additional elements seemed to be chosen and edited & played to fit with ease.
I spent a few days getting the arrangement and mix to work the elements as a long form track. I now had something that appeared to be darkly mysterious and foreboding yet as the piece progressed it introduces a shift of mood to hopefulness or enlightened senses & back again to the dark aesthetic it began with.
The last part of the creative process was creating a fitting title,
I struggled with this due the shifting moods and overall feel of the track. Its working title was simply "Untitled Long Form". I eventually settled on the abbreviated ULF: 0I, I feel this keeps its mysterious side and leaves the listener more room to interpret the track however they wish and maybe it leaves it open to a series of ULF tracks in the future?
Mick Chillage.credits:
released November 13, 2025
Written, Produced & Mastered by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin November 2025.
Art & Layout Michael Gainford
Image courtesy of Cory Mills,
Thank you Cory I miss your chats, kindness & friendship.
No Ai tools were used in the producing/recording or artwork process.

trackinfo.title: ULF: 0I
trackinfo.about:
Its been a while since I have worked on & released a long form piece although some longish tracks have appeared on some recent releases but nothing over the forty minute mark.
During a weekend in early November 2025 I was experimenting with some patches I had created on my beloved Prophet Rev2 one in particular had a some serious expansive sonic aesthetics, super low bass when tweaking certain filter envelopes and playing polyphonically on the keys utilising the lower, the mid and the higher keys at the same time added a mix of searing highs and rumbling lows.
This lead me to the ominous opening passage of this piece and inspired me rather quickly with other elements. The piece seems to shift from dark to light in mood and atmosphere, from a sense of dark mystery or foreboding to a sense of peace or enlightenment or subtle hopefulness.
I spent a few days bouncing back and fourth on the mix and arrangement until was satisfied that I had something that worked well as a long form work.
Due to the varying mood and aesthetics and emotive shifts I struggled to come up with a fitting title and as a place holder I just called it Untitled Long Form 01.
Eventually I decided that U.L.F 01 would be the title as it is very open to interpretation and has a certain mysterious feel to it.
This also leaves it open to perhaps a series of new Long Form pieces for the future.

Mick Chillage.title: Undercurrents
Mick Chillage.about:
"Undercurrents" was created in mid summer of 2024 with the first track, when I finished the piece I was curious about certain sonic elements, the sustained and slightly modulated high pitched drone, the super low ominous bass that you feel as much as you hear and the sweeping & rising modulated synth FX/atmo part. What if these became the foundations of an album and continued to carry new pieces as they emerged in sequence?
"Part 2" was a piece of improvised ambience that had been sitting on my hard drive since spring and one that I was very happy with, I dropped it into the project and mixed it with the elements from the above mentioned sounds & it just clicked into place, the next two works were conceived on top of the original foundations/undercurrents which worked as a nice source of inspiration.
Dedicated to the memory of Cory Mills
Thank you for your friendship & for sharing so many wonderful images.

Mick Chillage.title: Urban Nature
Mick Chillage.about:
Urban Nature was recorded in late spring/early summer of 2021
and was inspired by a wonderful section of wild land known as the
The River Dodder Valley Park that sits between two urban locations near my home. The Dodder river springs from the Dublin mountains, the park is full of wildlife and has a path that runs through it for about 5km, which has recently been expanded.
Ive always found it fascinating that this thriving natural habitat sits near dual carriageways, the M50 motorway, its flyovers, local shopping centres and even a cement plant nearby. There's a waterfall and a weir and remnants of the old canal system that led from the old developing Tallaght village to the heart of Dublin's city centre.
So armed with my Zoom portable recorder I gathered lots of various recordings, nature and urban sounds and they inspired me to improvise over these elements using keys, mainly virtual piano and subtle synths & effects etc. The music would sit along the lines of modern/minimal classical and perhaps inspired by Harold Budd, Brian Eno etc.
I tried to capture certain locations along this path with certain sonic aesthetics. Part 3 for example was inspired by a large electrical pylon that sits close to the river bank and its heavy cables span across the river. Birds nest nearby and I can imagine the possible electrical interference that the various animals may hear or feel so the piano part modulates and gets almost lost at times with a slightly unsettling level of interference & unnatural noise.
Ultimately I created the album to be listened to in one sitting, trying to capture a soundtrack to the 5-6km walk with the different sounds and feelings you may gather from these polar opposite environments coexisting, so the CD is mixed as one track but each piece is easily identifiable as they start and end.
The individual tracks are offered digitally and come with the purchase of the CD at bandcamp.
The album is dedicated to the memory of Steve Brown.
Mick Chillage
April 2022

released May 8, 2022
All tracks, written, produced and mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin Ireland 2021.

Mick Chillage.title: Variants of Perception
Mick Chillage.label: Carpe Sonum Records
Mick Chillage.about: A man of prolific means and invention to match, Mick Chillage is one of those names virtually synonymous with deep, high-quality, far-reaching electronic music, an artist who easily glides between modes of ambience and rhythmic facility with a finely-honed, agile grace. His return to the Carpe Sonum fold is no less dramatic. The lengthy pieces adorning this latest work allow the artists usual stately pace to run free and allow his gradually dawning motifs room to pulse and breathe; ten minutes of a typical Chillage piece often exposes more ideas per second than other artists whole volumes. The dramatis analogae of Echoes of Perception takes in a veritable smorgasbord of synths, modules, pads, sequencers, bass, and perambulating ghost-voices that together paint a unearthly picture teeming with all sorts of wonderfully devised gossamer and broad, electronic gimcrackery. His many collaborations with Lee Norris as Autumn of Communion seemed to have rubbed off on this one, as Chillage fairly revels in a bubbling tableau of starshine beats, spaced-out shimmer, and supple beds of pillowly-soft rhythmatix. A Recollection of Distant Environments finds him channelling the ever-present (and reverential) Namlookisms of yore but skewed through a Berlin school filter of chocolate-coated sequencers, and the kind of beat structure so beloved of IDMers from Boards of Canada to Black Dog, further reincarnated from late 90s imprints such as n5MD, De:focus, and Rephlex. Sweet licorice labyrinths of sonic perambula to get all twisty in.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released March 25, 2022
DUBLIN 2019-2020
Everyone views the world through different eyes, if we all try tounderstand and respectthe perception of others maybe our planet could be a more peaceful place.
 Mick Chillage 2022
All tracks written and produced by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin Ireland between 2019 and 2020.
Mastered by Black Particle.
Thanks to Dave at Carpe Sonum for his carefully chosen selections, Al for the warm and detailed mastering, and Kracker for his patience and brilliant visions.
Special thanks to all that support and inspire my music, and to my family and friends for being there.

Mick Chillage.title: Variants Of Perception
Mick Chillage.about:
Variants of Perception was originally released on Carpe Sonum Records in Spring of 2022.
Comprising of tracks recorded between 2019 & 2020 the album sees me returning to my trademark mixture of deep Ambient tones & atmospheres with a mix of various electronic music influences with moments of Intricate IDM beats, Dub & downtempo breakbeat etc but with a generous sprinkling of improvised leads and emotive melodic flourishes.
Resulting in a rather personal exploration of what it is to be human and triggers memories, feelings & emotions through contemporary & sometimes experimental electronic sound.

Mick Chillage.title: Voice of the Ancients
Mick Chillage.about:
"Voice of the Ancients" was born from a rather simple yet inspiring lead sound I created on the Moog Grandmother, the first few notes I played on the keys with this sound became the foundation of the track.
The sound is played in two separate audio elements, the second part has the higher octave improv lead part which I chopped up and placed at various points.
As these parts looped around I could hear a human voice accompanying these synth parts in my head. I grabbed my portable zoom recorder and with my headphones I tried my best to perform some vocal textures along with what I had already played. Out of the two minutes or so of various vocal passes I found one that appeared to work, I sampled it and treated in various ways and played it on the keys at different octaves, I was surprised how natural it sounded to my ears and I moved forward with the track.
Programmed Drums and percussive parts plus other found sounds, further Moog sounds were created until I had a structure that I could work with.
Unintentionally I feel I created perhaps something that harks back to an era of the early 90's Ambient that fused subtle ethnic elements with a strong FAX records influence in particular.
Written and recorded between the 16th/18th of November 2022.
Equipment used:
Moog Grandmother mono synth [overdubbed]
My voice
Zoom Z1 portable recorder.
Ableton Live 10 for audio arranging, digital treatments and FX.
Virtual 808 style drum kit.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released November 18, 2022
Layout & design: Michael Gainford.
Written,recorded & mastered by Michael Gainford
at the Igloo Dublin November 2022.

Mick Chillage.title: Water Air Light
Mick Chillage.about:
Water Air Light was compiled & conceived in late July 2022.
The tracks contained were created with a rather large time space between them.
Track 1 "The Cycle of Water" was written and recorded in late Autumn of 2021. Inspired by a domestic appliance at my home, I recorded the water sounds and mechanical elements and then found particular moments within these and looped and manipulated, various synths formed a foundation and the additional improvised leads and piano add a further organic feel to the track.
Track 2 "Dreams Of Light" was composed in late January of 2022 and was inspired by the creeping extending duration of daylight that slowly begins at this time of year in the southern Hemisphere.
Track 3 is an alternative take of "Intervals Of light" released in 2019 where I manipulated and rearranged the source sounds and introduced some new synth parts & additional FX to create a more ethereal and subtle take on the original.
This version was created end of July 2022.
Overall the album has a fairly earthy/emotive feel and the title just seemed to sit with the sonic themes.
Mick Chillage.credits:
released July 28, 2022
Written & produced & mastered by Michael Gainford at the Igloo Dublin between 2018 & 2022.

Mick Chillage.title: Waveshape Fiction
Mick Chillage.about:
What the label Anodize say:
Arch-texturologist Mick Chillage sidesteps ambient phraseology to present on Anodize his new contemporary electro project, The Shape, every bit as thrilling and energizing as Dopplereffekt, John Carpenter & Alan Howarth, Mr. Velcro Fastener and Anthony Rother. Unlike his colleagues, Chillage manages to tweak the formula a turn or two, resulting in some nimble synth parabolas riding atop steely, corkscrew rhythms.
Irish electronic musician Chillage should be no stranger to followers of Anodize. His presence has not only graced the label via last year's stunning Autumn of Communion 2 project (in collaboration with Lee Anthony Norris), but also this month's excellent ambient travelogue "Pixels", already sold out and now the stuff of collectors' shelves and fortunate enthusiasts worldwide.
The Shape is a unique work in Chillage's canon, however, displaying a markedly different musical persona, one wholly enamored with the taut percussive vortices of classic electro. Where others bow mercilessly to the tyranny of the beat, Chillage one-ups the game: the grand and grimy cinema audio verit of Carpenter and Howarth's synth fantasias loom large in Chillage's visor, but uninterested in mere copyism, The Shape gnarls his vintage electronics into a whiplash frenzy bent to its own pretzel logic.

Mick Chillage.title: Footsteps In Fog [Extended]
Mick Chillage.about:
Footsteps in Fog was created shortly after the passing of the American minimalist composer Harold Budd in December 2020. Harold's music was a huge influence on myself and so many others, his music touched the soul and stirred the senses with his less is more and improvisational approach where every note, sustain & silence played an equal part in creating a haunting stillness which was deeply poignant and emotive.
Harold's unique compositions like many of the greats will continue to resonate with music lovers in years to come.
While "Footsteps In The Fog" is certainly inspired by Harold's legacy I also see it as a reflection on the year that was 2020 and is dedicated to the other great artists that left us this year and also for anyone that found 2020 a personally challenging one.
Originally the track was a five minute piece, on the 22nd of December I returned to it and added additional sonic elements and rearranged and mixed it into what is now just over nine minutes.
I hope you enjoy it.
Mick Chillage 2020
